It is quiet and you don't get that "frying odor" associated with hot oil and a pan..I know there are some out there that are quite pricey..I would wait for a sale and tbh it is abit bulky and storage is an issue..I also combined some items like the fries and the nuggets and they turned out ok (just saying) Peace to all..remember to vote!!!
Very good. Like it a lot. Easy to fry things now without oil. My husband love it. Can use it to cook fried chicken tender, pork chops,fries, cookies , empanadas,fried dumplings .....

This unit is basically a small but powerful convection oven. Follow directions/suggestions in manual and you'll do fine. Great for frozen fries, crispy chicken wings or fish. Requires frequent turning, shaking, rearranging of food items for even cooking but much faster and cleaner than oil fry. This is a small unit...if feeding or prepping for more than 2 get their larger unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cooks practically anything and so easy!
reviews.reviewText: Greatest fryer ever! Chicken nuggets, mozzarella sticks, tater tots come out so crispy. I’ve cooked pork chops and chicken breasts in it too. Break off the sticks and you can make corn dogs in it too. Hot dogs and brats are superb almost like cooking them on a grill. The only thing I wouldn’t recommend is pizza rolls-they explode too easily. Compact design too, hardly takes up any room on the counter. Spray with cooking spray before using and clean up is a breeze. Best purchase I’ve made in a long time!

I love this MACHINE... it is wonderful...best healthly way to do fried food without the grease and it is quick...

chicken wings. pork chops the best...umm

I love the machine.. I put veggies, brussel sprouts and hot dogs so far in there. The reason it loses a start is the book is totally wrong for the veggies. You really have to watch it and dont follow the times in the book to the letter.

reviews.reviewTitle: well designed and easy to use for healthy "fried" comfort foods!
reviews.reviewText: I couldn't be happier with this purchase! Hassle-free, delicious, healthy fries (and much more) whenever the cravings hit or my mouth just gets bored :) I can't wait to try making taro fries! My nephew says he regularly makes steak and chicken wings in his and that they're delicious! Who knew air could "fry"?! This is a game changer and a must-have for singles and families alike :)

Absolutely LOVE this air fryer. Excellent for meals for one person. Definitely don't recommend it for a family to use, though; It's quite small. I use mine all the time. It is so easy to clean. No scrubbing needed. Highly recommend.

I've been wanting an air fryer but don't have space for a bigger one and I'm only one my household. This unit is perfect for one person and is small enough to not take up a bunch of space. It is awesome for making chicken wings without all the extra grease.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy clean up, great size, makes delicious food!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a gift for my daughter. She loves it! It has a non-stick basket, which makes it perfect for a wipe down clean-up. Just don’t use it in the house if you have indoor birds. Teflon can kill them.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Made my second batch of frozen fries tonight. Seemed like they needed a few more minutes, so I added some more time. The fan quit within seconds and now this is useless. Waiting for a response from the manufacturer. I would avoid this brand.

This thing was cute. Perfect size for 1 person, hopefully worked as well as the bigger models... But 2 minutes after unboxing while removing the inner basket, the handle came off in my fingers. I will be seeking a replacement or refund.

We purchased this small air fryer for our camper. Its compact but does what we need it to do. We mainly use it for french fries, hashbrowns and appetizers for 2 people. I would not recommend this size for a family. But works great for our needs.

This little guy is great. Not very big, but I didn't expect it to be. With no heat up time required, I can can cook chicken nuggets for my kid in about 7 minutes and they are crispy. That alone makes it worth it. Plus, It looks really cool!

I was recently giving a very large air fryer brand new it did not work it was a very expensive one I still wanted one so I bought this one it's just the right size for one person and I love how Crystal it makes everything and how fast it works without heating up the kitchen thank you

Great unit so far. Looking forward to all its possibilities. Perfect for one or two people, max. Bought on prime day, but somehow the price dropped $13 the day after I purchased it. Only negative so far.

I loved my air fryer! It’s easy to use and pretty quick! I wish it was a bit bigger but I knew the size was small! Even though I do enjoy it all the time! Fish sticks, pooped shrimp, 4 pieces of drums or chicken tights, etc
LOVE IT LOVE IT I am so pleased with my air fryer. Great for one or two people. It makes the best chicken, fish and potatoes among other things. Great product for the price
Just used my Air Fryer for the first time!! French fries cooked perfectly. Easy to clean after use. The two quart size is perfect for me with room to spare. Can't wait to cook chicken or fish. Yum.

reviews.reviewTitle: Air fryer time & temp learning curve, read the chart.
reviews.reviewText: Air fryer new to us, but works nicely. Can keep crisp foods from reheating soggy in microwave. Small counter footprint, is tall. Basket easy to clean, hand wash or dishwasher.

This air fryer is so cute and portable! I love my tater tots cooked to perfection without the bad fat. Follow the instructions! And it really helps to “shake” the fries for a crispy golden brown outcome

I bought this air fryer because of it's smaller size, and it works like a charm. I hate heating up the oven to cook meals in the summer, and this fryer cooks fries, bacon, and chicken perfectly without heating up the house. I like to spray a little oil on the dry products (fries, breading on chicken) to help with the browning and flavor. Basket washes up quick and easy. This is my second Dash product, and I love them both.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is a Compact size but very functional!
reviews.reviewText: This is my second compact Dash Air Fryer & it is perfect to air fry for one person. I use it for fish, meat, veggies, potato fries! Doesn’t take up a lot of space so storage is easy or just leave it on the counter.

I love this little air fryer. It even goes on vacation with me sometimes. It's perfect for just a couple of people, and I made so many wonderful things in it that are healthy and without oil. I purchased it because it was the least expensive one, and it was small, but this little air fryer is a great buy!
Good enough small size air fryer, Hrd to get the hang of unless used constantly, but when it works it works well. have even done some "baking" in it - donut holes and donuts come out well
I was not able to use the fryer because it did not come with all the right pieces. It was missing the fry pan which should have been included. Will be returning.

reviews.reviewTitle: reasonable price, quality comparable to big brand
reviews.reviewText:
just buy it, you don't need to follow big brands, this one work just like every other $200 dollar ones.
this is my 3rd air fryer, will be a gift to my parents (after trying it out)

I cook almost everything in this now that i bought it. It is extremely convenient, and it does cook things very crisp, just like it says. Much better than a toaster oven. I love it and it is much smaller than the other air fryers, it takes up a fraction of the space.
I’m late to the air fryer came but I absolutely love this thing! Super easy to use makes making meals so much quicker and healthier!

This compact air fryer is amazing! It’s perfect for 2-3 people. Instead of preheating the oven for 15 mins, I can just easily put my food in the fryer, and less than 10 mins the food is ready. Also the size of the fryer is perfect to store.

reviews.reviewTitle: Temperature starts at 400-350-250. So easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: Happy with my purchase. This was rated the best. Makes shrimp in 8 minutes. Sweet potatoes, cut in slices, add cinnamon cloves, & cook at 400’. Set timer, add drizzle of honey. Easy to clean, small enough to put in cabinet. Highly recommended this product.

I love this air fryer, and I use it daily.I've been making a variety of frozen foods. It's quick and super easy to use. Right now, the cooking times are a hit and miss because the packages do not have the specifics on air fryers, but it is fun to experiment. I love it when the food comes out with that nice crunch,it didn't take that long and I didn't have to monitor it the whole time. It doesn't take up a lot of room, and it fits on my small counter.

I like the color and everything but the temperature knob do not work and when I opened the package a really bad odor came out like if the compact air fryer has a chemical in it. Can’t use it because it won’t turn the knob around
My first Air Fryer. OMG!!!!!!! I’m sir frying everything. So far I air fried, calamari, okra, Mac and cheeese for the extra crunh, wingettes, onion, and did I say OKRA!!!!! Delicious 😜😜😜😜

I LOVE my air fryer. It makes the juiciest chicken, the best french fries, and I could eat brussel sprouts all day out of this thing! The only downside is it's size. However, I didn't want a big air fryer, as I knew I'd be the only one eating out of it most of the time. If you're looking at making food for just 1-2 people, this is the perfect size air fryer. If you need to make food for more than that, I'd buy a bigger one.
i like the design of it, very modern & cute. however the capacity is really small. you can fit about 5-6 wings and that's it, so i have to do several batches if i want more food.
Ugh, this thing is so stinking cute and makes delish food! Perfectly sized for two people. Basket is super easy to clean and nonstick, so be gentle! It earned a spot on my counter for sure!

Boyfriend and I are living in very small quarters so this fit perfectly into our lifestyle, although you can only make about one serving of food at a time, it doesn’t take long to cook even frozen items so you can dish out two servings in less than 30mins usually, depending on what you’re making I guess. Product description is fair and accurate. Only have had it for about 6 months but so far it’s working well and has not had any issues.

I bought it mainly to cook the french fries, but what a disappointment!
The potatoes came out uncooked and not crispy and brown at all.
I had to send it back!
New to air fryers? Want to try something simple and easy to see if it's for you? This is your model. It is simple, a single drawer for single to dual servings of food, and a timer knob. So easy!

I got this for myself. Next thing I know it belongs to my daughter and they were very happy which makes me happy so I need to order another one. My husband, who is the naysayer in the house, was astonished at how well this works. So he’s waiting for me to order another one.
I bought his to try and see if I would like air frying-and for the color. This has a small basket but still works great and doesn't take up much space. Great for small batches of food.
We love the air frying and how it works! After having for 3 months we started to notice peeling of the inside😕. We are disappointed in that. It is not really usable now

Hard to clean. Very good product if you are cooking for one person, if you are cooking for more, get a bigger one.

I use aluminum foil to catch the juices so it isn't as hard to clean.

Very satisfied with my purchase!
It’s easy to use and really does give a fried feel to most of the foods I have made. I didn’t have any luck making sweet potato fries with it but everything else has been great. Good price too!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product at a fair price!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this air fryer after my husband suffered a heart attack because he LOVES french fries but doesn't much care for them baked. This thing is AWESOME! It's convenient, easy to use & clean, and fits nicely in a bottom cabinet. I highly recommend this product for a single person or couple as the basket is just large enough to cook for 1 or 2 people.

This little thing ROCKS and is my new favorite kitchen appliance! Easy to use. Uses much less oil. Doesn't heat up my entire kitchen. I've had it for several months and the newness has worn off but I still use it several times a week.
Great small air fryer for the two of us. In fact we have two of them. We use them often. Food cooks great. We just did crab cakes and they came out just perfect.
I use this every day. Works for sandwiches, wings, reheating dinner, heating a pizza slice, etc. Quick to prepare a meal and quick to clean.

Had been waiting for it's arrival the moment it was purchased, as soon as it was at my doorstep I could not help myself and went straight for the playing.Loved the color (aqua), the structure and just how simple it is to use. I made some pretty amazing, juicy hamburger patties which is now my lunch. Was a bit worried about the cleaning part but it turned out to be pretty fast and easy. Thinking about purchasing one for my mom in California, she would enjoy this!

I finally had to jump on the band wagon and try an air fryer! I was excited that it's small and compact so it doesn't take a lot of room on my counter. The fry bin is a good size for 1-2 servings which is perfect for just me. Don't expect to make enough for a whole family though. I've used it for a few weeks now and really loving it!!
My wife and I are empty nesters and this air fryer is just the right size for 2. Stores well and works great. Great price sealed the deal. Very happy with this purchase.
nice size for a single person, or even two. loved that. nice look. but the no dishwasher thing was a pain. ended up buying a another from another company.

I love that this product is easy to use, cooks very well and it's so pretty as well! Also, the surface of the air fryer doesn't heat much when cooking, which was one of my fears. I've cooked fried chicken, burgers, bacon and fries and they come out perfect. Works well reheating fried food when cold and soggy. Highly recommended!
It’s great for me when I’m cooking for just me. It’s fast and easy. The size is what I love the most. It stores wonderfully. I love my little air fryer.
This little red machine is like the little red engine that could! I love my air dryer, it’s compact, easy to use and does a great job.
This is great for those that have a small kitchen. This is great and cooks everything and makes it easy. I love my food crispy so this was great.

Do not buy this product. It does a great job until it doesn't!! The first one I ordered lasted almost 4 months Amazon replaced it after the heating unit burned out. The second one has lasted two months. Right in the middle of cooking it just quits the heating unit is once again burnt out. I'm so disappointed in this product.
This is very easy to use and I love the food I get. I need to experiment more and try more recipe's but so far, it's great. Very easy to clean which makes it even better.
My first air-fried french fries turned out not great. Followed all steps but both times they all were pale brown sticks of limp potatoes.
Wife loved this one so much, she sent this one to the RV and bought a same colored larger one for inside our home. Makes good food!

I read a lot of the reviews and was somewhat leery, I have only used it for chicken and it works great, it has not scratched at all, I use a soft toothbrush for cleaning it with soapy dish water. I am very careful pulling out the basket I can see how the handle would break if you are not real careful. Chicken comes out moist and crisp

reviews.reviewTitle: Food still tastes great using this air fryer.
reviews.reviewText: Love this air fryer. It cooks everything crispy, even when I fill the basket all the way up!
This thing is horrible you think an air fryer with still fry your food it’s nothing more than a broiler and it doesn’t even cook the food on the bottom

reviews.reviewTitle: Be sure to remove the rubber from basket
reviews.reviewText: Simple and reliable, be sure to remove the rubber that keeps the basket from scratching before using. Also don’t fill too high in case grease or moisture from splashing on the heating element

Wanted to try air fryer and bought this because of price. Love it! Great for cooking fries and tater tots. Reheats pizza and its better than fresh! Still learning, but can't wait to try more things! Really easy to clean, also.

reviews.reviewTitle: Single serving or 2 very small servings. Appliance is just for cooking pre-cooked fries, tots, etc.
reviews.reviewText:
The Dash 1.2 L Air Fryer is really only for 1 person. I followed the breaded (floured) chicken recipe that came with the fryer, and the chicken was black in spots and still floured in others. I cooked until it was just at 165°. I turned it when I was supposed to. It turned out like jerky...very tough.

Because frozen french fries, onion rings, tater tots, mozzarella sticks, etc. are pre-fried when manufactured, this air fryer might do well with them, but you are still eating fried foods When you air fry them. You can only make a serving of frozen fries at a time. It would take too long to make 2 servings. The first batch would be cold by the time the second batch was cooked. I tried pre-cooked breaded okra and spent 30 cooking it. It went in the trash because they did not brown at all.

This will be going back. I don't need another appliance that is only good for one thing...cooking pre-cooked foods. I really wanted this to work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for one or two servings
reviews.reviewText: This is a great compact air fryer. I've used it many times and it's perfect for one or two servings. The basket isn't as bit as a full-sized air fryer since it's round instead of oblong, but you can adjust the arrangement of food. For example, instead of wrapping a slice of bacon around a spear of asparagus I cut the asparagus into pieces and wrapped each in a piece of bacon It held about three full chicken wings and cooked them evenly. It has a dial for the timer and temperature instead of digital settings, but I don't think cooking times are that exact so it shouldn't matter and it makes it very simple to operate. The only issue with that is you can't cancel or reduce the cooking time, but you can pull the basket out of the fryer and the timer will still count down even though the heater and fan have stopped. I don't know if this would be allowed in a dorm room, but it would be perfect for a student.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks good, no inner basket, only cooks small quantities
reviews.reviewText:
This is my third air fryer, I bought this to replace my old one during a move (gave my old one to my friend). I've also bought one for my mom. I use these things extensively to cook meat, make fries, roast veggies, almost every day.

While its got a smaller footprint on my counter and looks super cute, the basket is much smaller which leads to uneven cooking if its more than half full. I have burned items at the top while soggy on the bottom for this reason. My other issue with this item is that while other fryers have a basket you can lift the food out, this one only has a disc with holes that pulls out the bottom, so you have to lift/scoop the food out with tongs or spoon, which is a pain with things like fries. If you try to tip it out the oil will run into the food. The disc also doesnt really drain oil that well compared to other air fryers.

This one is good if you are one or two people in a very compact kitchen and cooking a couple large items like chicken pieces, but otherwise would recommend one of the other fryers instead.

Got this little air fryer from bed bath and beyond a while back. It is very useful, especially for a single guy. Cleaning is all right as I usually put the tray and rack into dish washer directly.

As many reviewers pointed out, the only major draw of this cool item is the coating of the rack is peeled in just couple usages. So, I bought a 6 in round chrome rack from amazon (Mrs. Anderson's Baking 43193... https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000I1ZUWO?ref=ppx_pop_mob_ap_share) and it fits nicely inside the tray and I finally got my crispy air fried chicken back!

As much as we love our Air Fryer, and we use it almost every day, I must alert you to a problem we have experienced.
It really deserves 5-stars, but I wanted people be warned, and figured it would be found more easily in the 1-stars.
VERY Hot air comes out the back while it is operating! We have run it several times close to the kitchen wall and to my dismay I found that the 70’s vintage Nutone intercom (and AM/FM radio) has been damaged by the super hot air. The plastic face and bezel and some of the knobs have been melted and distorted. Electronics OK, cosmetics and tuning knobs messed up. Oh well, this must be the 20th Century colliding with the 21st head on… like Global Warming.
I do love a repair project but this one is going to be a challenge.
"Keep away from the wall and backsplash" should have been in the manual. Well, maybe it was there, I didn’t read the manual.

reviews.reviewTitle: A whole lotta watts for this size basket!
reviews.reviewText: This is my first air fryer and I didn't know what to expect. I only hoped it would fry much better than a microwave, and of course it does! What wouldn't? If there was such a thing as a perfect air fryer you would never have to stir the food, but nothing is perfect and even the expensive models ask you to turn the food over once or twice while cooking. This only has 1,000 watts, but with a 1.2 liter cooking basket you're going to have much more available heat than when a 1,500 watt model tries to cook a 5 L basket of food. You can pay a lot more for digital temperature and programmable digital timers, but when you get right down to it, cooking is more of an artform than a science. Setting those numbers to exactly 390 degrees and 18 minutes won't ever guarantee that the food will be right, not when there is so much variability in the quality of the food, the exact amount of the food and how long or how cold it may have been frozen. All of that is why this Dash fryer, with it's mechanical dials cooks every bit as good as the fancy models. I can appreciate the small footprint, and the available colors make it that much nicer (I chose red). For some reason the timer dial cannot be turned backwards, so try not to overshoot the mark you want. Also, I added a dot of white-out to the dial because the pointer dot was black like the rest of the dial. My favorite food to cook in this happens to be Ore-Ida crinkle-cut fries. These include some light seasoning and they brown nicely without a drop of added oil.

reviews.reviewTitle: If I loved it so much, why one star?
reviews.reviewText: I received my Dash air fryer for Christmas and was so excited to use it. It’s the perfect aqua color for my kitchen and the perfect size for making breakfast, lunch, or dinner for myself and my 6 lb. Chihuahua. I’d used other Dash products before and couldn’t be happier with them. (I LOVE my egg cooker) Some things I’ve cooked in my air fryer are: hot dogs, chicken thighs, turkey burgers, frozen fries (Irish and sweet potato) smoked sausage with onions & bell pepper, chicken nuggets—even finished baking some biscuits in it once when my countertop oven went out before they were completely done—and many other things. So why did I give it one star? Because almost immediately the non-stick coating started peeling off, and after only a few months of use, it became so bad I cannot use it. I understand that coating is unhealthy if ingested, and I don’t know how much of it my little dog and I may have already consumed. I have no choice but to throw the fryer away. It honestly baffles me that it has gotten so many four and five star ratings. I always washed it by hand, was careful with it, and never put it in the dishwasher. And as a mother/grandmother who has cooked for a large family for over fifty years, I know my way around a kitchen and certainly know how to take care of my tools and appliances. I loved the convenience of the air fryer and everything else about it, but the faulty non-stick coating makes it useless. That’s too bad. I will miss it, but I will never buy anything made by Dash that has a non-stick coating. Someday, I may try a different brand. But right now, I’m suspicious of them all.

This is my very first air fryer. I've been doing research online and many say that this one is too small and that I should get a larger capacity unit. However I'm a single guy and it's worked out perfectly for me. I didn't want a huge contraption taking up counter space. For someone that doesn't cook very much, this appliance makes heating up frozen fries, chicken tenders etc a breeze. I've also made roasted cauliflower and will be trying brussel sprouts next. This air fryer is perfect for one person.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cute air fryer but frying plate peels
reviews.reviewText: I really want to love this air fryer. I bought this at Sam's Club last year when it was on sale for $29.99. It is a cheap way to test out air fryer. It is easy to use and compact. But unfortunately the frying plate peels terribly. After less than 2 months of usage (2-3 times a week) I notice peeling on the frying plate and the rate of peeling increases exponentially. I clean the inserts by hand and only use soft clothes. I contacted Dash customer service and they send me a new one. So this time around I started using air fryer liner. The liner helped and after some usage I did not see any wear on the frying plate. Since they are cheap on Amazon (3 packs of 150 for $6.99), I didn't mind. But unfortunately the peeling started again and just like before, once it started it gets worse very quickly. Since I use the liner, it doesn't affect the cooking but it sure is ugly to look at. I have basically given up on it and won't buy another Dash product. It is just badly made. I am now doing research for a different (bigger) air fryer.
It functions fine. But the nonstick coating on the bottom basket insert came off onto fries leaving a black film.

I purchased this in early November and used it bout 4 times. I don't fry much but this was a small appliance, which I thought would work well for two people in a small kitchen. This is what I discovered: The basket is so small that it may not hold sufficient food for 2. A second batch has to be made The lid will not close down if the handle is in place, so I had to use tongs to place the basket in, and pull it out. The temperature only goes up to 375. I discovered that most fried goods require a higher temp. The plug is held in place magnetically-not great as it may slip. Most importantly, after using it only 4 times, it stopped working. It will not heat up. What a disappointment and waste of my money.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this for $36, well worth the money!
reviews.reviewText:
I just picked this up at Target (not Amazon, but I put my reviews here) for $35.99 for a labor day sale. So far I'm very happy with my purchase! I'm not a huge fan of microwaves (except for stuff like oatmeal) I just think it makes food bland and soggy. I've been wanting a convection toaster oven for a while, but they're super pricey for me at the moment. I currently have the fryer sitting on a dresser in my rented-room/office (think studio apartment)

I just re-heated a Cajun chicken leg I had made two nights back for dinner, and it was honestly even better then when I first made it! The skin was super crispy but with absolutely no grease and the chicken was heated evenly to the bone after about 7 minutes in the air fryer.

Pros:

-Lightweight
-Super easy to clean
-Quick and simple
-Food tastes great
-Perfect for a dorm room/studio apartment if they're allowed
-Loads of options for foods you can make

Cons:

-I am worried about the non-stick coating inside. I'm not sure how it'll last before I'll have to request a replacement. Definitely don't use any metal utensils to remove food!
-It's not very big, don't expect to cook a chicken. Perfect for small meals and left-overs.
-You can't cook really greasy food in it, things like: fatty bacon, sausages, burgers, ect.

What Would I Pay:

I think I'd happily pay $50 for this. So if you have a coupon or it's on sale, go for it!

I have the previous gen of this product but as far as I can tell the only diff is that this one has a more rounded look at the top edge. I love my Dash air fryer (in fact I love other Dash "mini" products too!). I eat veggie 'meats' so I cook my hamburgers and chicken strips in this, along with battered fish, tots, egg rolls, really anything I can possibly cook in it because it's so fast and easy. My only issue is that the grill isn't as non-stick as I'd like and takes some elbow grease to clean. At first it was good but after a year of use (but no scratches on the surface coating) the non-stick just doesn't stay non-stick. I don't know if it dries out or really what happens to it. It doesn't flake off or anything though so that's good, it just isn't 'wipe clean' anymore. Still, I love it, recommend it, and if you haven't looked into other Dash products I recommend you do!!

This product is a lifesaver! I got it as a gift from my mother and I now cannot live without it. If you are anything like me, I cannot handle fried things in any capacity. I used to bake everything and then my girlfriend came along. Boy did everything change, so we compromised. I wanted less grease to upset my stomach and she wanted crispy everything. This Dash air fryer is amazing.
I get less oil, she gets the taste and textures she wants and the time it takes is cut in half!
Now let me yell you about the mess it makes.....practically none. There is one part that separates from the bottom, just lift it out give the frying container and the buffer a good scrub and let dry.
P.s. Try kale chips in this bad boy. Amazing 😍

I am SO happy I decided to get this as my first air fryer. At first the whole concept seemed intimidating to me but it this little fryer was super easy to use and I was hooked after one use. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is the timer and automatic stop function stopped working after 1 week. It was still fully functional and I just had to use my own timer after I turned it on. I haven't read any other people having that same issue so it could have been a fluke. Also it is a great size for one person but if I am cooking for me and my husband or meal prepping I have to do things in batches so that can get kind of tedious. My suggestion would be to get a digital fryer that is 5L or up if you like to meal prep...if you have the room for it. If not this little fryer will definitely do the trick!! :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Paint came off on food, Good hot dog cooker, nothing with breading on it
reviews.reviewText: First, it was a gift to me so can't verify with my account. It is perhaps the best hot dog/encased meats cooker. Everything else I have tried has come out substandard to other cooking methods. It's just basically an accelerated convection oven. It will cook non-breaded chicken ok but not as well as a panini press. Anything that has a bunch of small pieces where the air can;t get between get half cooked, like fries, onion rings etc. because it has no layers. And finally, after about 10 uses the paint on the "basket" started coming off on the food and it started rusting. It really needs a better coating or stainless. I set hot dogs on top of skewer sticks to keep the paint off them and that's all I use it for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great gift/purchase but a little too small
reviews.reviewText: We love our air fryer! We got it off our wedding registry. It encourages us to eat healthy and get creative. My only complaint is the tiny tiny frying drawer. It’s pretty deep but if you stack anything past the first layer, it doesn’t get fried, forcing you to lay about 15 french fries at a time before being able to pull those out and try for more. Most likely, if we use this one as much as I think we will, I’ll be purchasing a much larger one soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact Dash Air Fryer B-Day Gift
reviews.reviewText: True to advertised, it is small, compact, and makes enough tater tots for a side dish for two tater-tot fiends. It had been suggested to me to pre-heat for five minutes and to spritz the tots with a mist of oil. I confess to adding more tots than I should have. (I cooked about a third of a bag.) However, they came out wonderfully crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. For this fryer, I cooked them for about 15 minutes at 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Love it! Thanks for the birthday gift, sis!

reviews.reviewTitle: You should probably spend a bit more
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to like this product. I've used it for several months and have had inconsistent results. It functions but food cooks unevenly a lot of the time, even with added oil. Fresh fries came out burnt on the end and soft in the middle. I guess there's a reason there are more expensive air fryers after all.

This is great when cooking for one or two. I was able to cook a dozen wings, although it did take a little longer. The key is to flip food to ensure even cooking. It'll be raw on one side, and if you fill the basket too high, items high up may burn. This is a smaller air fryer, so keep that in mind. I find it's perfect when cooking for one. The only thing that hasn't come out perfectly crispy are sweet potatoes, but zucchini fries were very crispy! I think pre-breaded frozen items fry up the best, but I did bread some chicken breasts, and they turned out great.

I like this product. Didn't cook many items I would deep fry not because I worried overmuch about health but because dealing with the oil was a pain. Cooking in oven required a long time to pre-warm and was also inconvenient. Now I can cook a snack or side item in less time than my convection oven or frying grease would take to reach temperature. Cleanup is easy. Will try using oil in spritzer next. I find that coated items that are intended to be oven cooked already have oil on them. Healthier would be to not to eat many of these items.

Just got this today (Sam s club has them on sale for 30$!!) I read reviews on both sites before buying. Even with the good reviews I was still a little nervous. (I hate returning stuff.) However, this thing is great!!! I cooked battered shrimp and made some polish sausage crispy before adding to soup. The food cooked and browned beautifully. No more fried food for hubby!!

I have had this unit for several months and I use it a lot. It does much much more than a larger expensive one I had.
I think it makes perfect french fries and hot dogs. I have done lots of other things with it and have no complaints. This space saver device is a real surprise in the way it performs.
NOTE:
Be careful of which one you order. Amazon has the same unit going for $67.00. Get the one for $45.00. They are exactly the same. It must be a mistake. Do not hesitate with this because it happens to be one of the most wanted space saving air fryer on the market.

I love this air fryer! My husband thinks I’m a kitchen gadget sucker but even he loves this. The reason for 3 stars is that the nonstick finish is coming off the insert already! I’m getting nervous using it chipped so I’m trying to find a replacement. Prior to this, we were using every other day at least!

I have always seen the Air Fryer Oven on tv and have loved it every part of it, except for the price! I truly was so happy to find this fryer. I have not had a single complaint, it’s small, efficient, works effectively, and it’s even cute! I make the occasional dino chicken nugget and will never ever go back to the soggy nuggets that came out of the microwave, these are crisp on the out side and soft on the inside, Perfection at its finest! I would recommend this air fryer to anyone who doesn’t want the bulk and all the gadgets of the other air fryers! this is so cute on a counter top and it works so well! I definitely recommend!
Love,
your avid chicken nugget maker!

This thing is incredible. Someone gave me one and I didn't believe it would work. It does! I have never been a fast or fried food eater except
I love french fries and fish. This thing does both without all the grease and unhealthy frying. It also cooks chicken so juicy and tender but you
can leave the skin on and it comes out crispy and no fat greasy taste! Also turkey bacon, beef hot dogs, veggies, baked potato etc..It's easy
to use with a manual that give approx. cooking times but you'll adjust to it. I can't wait to try other foods. You won't regret buying this.

We just used this in our RV and it was perfect for frying a few items for dinner. We fit 6 chicken strips in the basket and they turned out super hot and crispy. My husband was skeptical that this would work - but it works well. It is easy to use. We also fried french fries and jalapeno poppers with great results. The only downside is that I think it is difficult to clean. I washed the basket and tray several times and they still seem sticky to me. Not sure if this is the coating or ? but have used my mom's air fryer (another model) and did not have this problem. This takes up very little cabinet space so it is perfect for storing in small spaces - that was one of my concerns when I purchased it because it seems that air fryers are so big. I would definitely recommend it!

Purchased in the aqua color as it was on sale for $35, though I would have preferred a black or white one. The color didn't matter, however, because it is for our motorhome and won't be sitting out. Very happy with how efficient it is. Since I figured out that an air fryer is a small convection oven, we use it all the time. Instead of firing up our large Viking oven I can usually use this for baking. I have small ramekins and a glass pan that fit inside perfectly. Since it is so small, I would suggest lowering the temp and start cooking with a shorter time.

This is our First Air Fryer. We are sold. Working on getting a bigger one now for a small family of 4. No more Cold waffle fry's from Chick-fil-A. This Air Fryer heats up everything as if it was freshly made. Really nice when cooking seasoned Fish. We have been using this for about 3 months now. No issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: coating on basket tray coming off😫
reviews.reviewText: I really like this product but as another reviewer said the coding on the tray is coming off and I am fearful that it is not very healthy. I got this as a gift and called the company today and they are going to send a new tray. Don’t know if others have had this problem. I love the crispiness of the wings And even hotdogs but hopefully it is not harmful to us or anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great size. Enough can be done for a family ...
reviews.reviewText:
Great size. Enough can be done for a family of three who are not big eaters.
When used with prepared items it worked well. The food was just right.
I found that when used on fresh vegetables it dried out the moisture from the vegetables. I am not giving up on it yet. Will see if I can master it.
I found that it was big, not around the circumference but in its height. I would call it cumbersome.
Wish I had chosen a different colour. I bought the silver.

Everything I expected. I was originally very happy with this purchase as it was a house warming gift for my daughter but I’m sad to say that only a few uses and 4 months later this product is no longer working. Also have not been able to get any help in returning this product or trying to use the warranty. I’m not happy at all with this product or outcome

I did not get mine on Amazon last summer and paid $20 more. That being said, I use this all the time. I love it. I have made French fries, taco salad shell and today homemade Taquitos. If you are thinking about purchasing one, do it. This one is great because it is small and easily put away. I have a small kitchen and it is never in the way.

Only tried a few times, but it's an impressive machine! I made onion rings the first time using the recipe provided. It said cook for 15 min on 400F which burnt the onions. Instead I did 5 minutes which was enough. The recipe itself was not great, my onion rings were bland so I would find your own recipes rather than follow the booklet. It is also good for just one person, but since it fries so fast that's not even a problem. Very cute looking, too, and easy to clean. Would recommend as it's not too expensive!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent. Way more efficient to roast veggies in this ...
reviews.reviewText: Excellent. Way more efficient to roast veggies in this Air Fryer than heating up an entire stove and heating the house up, especially in the summer heat. Husband and son friendly. Just turn the dial, shake it half way through, wait for bell ding, and it's nice and crispy. Love that it smaller than the others. Roasting broccoli as I write this! Easy to clean and store away.

reviews.reviewTitle: The little air fryer that could
reviews.reviewText: Great compact fryer, doesn't take up much counter space. Does a decent job and easy to use and clean, good for cooking for one person (capacity) at a time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great small appliance for nutrition in moderation
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this from a competing retailer on Black Friday, but this is a delightful device to own! I highly recommend it if you like fried foods but wish to eat more healthy. I would caveat that statement by saying this isn't a way to truly eat healthy food! It's simply less damaging when you want to "splurge" or "cheat" on your nutrition plan :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Great appliance to replace a microwave
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer is perfect for every day use. It’s compact so doesn’t take up a ton of counter space. It has completely replaced my microwave. I use it primarily to heat up meals for my son and myself. Great product for a 2 person household, would not work for larger amounts of food. And the price point is the best I found.

Mine to arrived 2 days a go. I tried it tonight. It works great so far. I made Nathan's French fries and cheese sticks. They were great. The only thing I can say so far is I didn't receive my 4 year warranty on it yet. They said it would be emailed to me and nothing yet. Will update if I have too.
This device is much too noisy for me to put up with running it for 20 to 40 minutes. Also the temperature dial marking jumps from 320 to 400 making it hard to sit to something like 375.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this product and as soon as I took it out of the box, there was a potent chemical smell. I put the basket and tray in the dishwasher, and put the rest of the appliance outside to air out. I also wiped it down with a wet soapy rag. Nothing got rid of the smell so I returned it.
This is very cute, but takes forever to cook things. I kept mine on the highest setting and it took an hour to cook 6 chicken wings. In the end I just put them in the oven to finish cooking.
Did not use, too small. Too high on the price for the size. The product big but can not hold hardly anything to make. Make a 1 hand full of fries.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good machine. It makes me eat very healthy.
reviews.reviewText: I like fried foods. I use this machine to make my favory food every time now. Cooking without lots of oil really changes the taste, but still not bad. It makes me eat very healthy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Teflon comes off after a few uses
reviews.reviewText: The Teflon on the basket is already coming off after 5 uses. I can’t even use it anymore.
It’s been hit or miss what cooks up properly. We’ve used it only a handful of times and now the Basket will not disconnect from the handle for cleaning. Cooks pretty small batches
Plastic handle broke off after 10 uses.
Died after 4 uses, day 35. Not eligible for return as I am 5 days past return date.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t know how I live without one
reviews.reviewText: My kids love chicken nugget and fries. We put some in frozen and within 4 mins done super super crispy. Thousand time better than an oven or toaster over. Even better than real frying no soggy greasy. I have to buy another one.
Amazing how well this product cooks. I love mine and use it all the time. I recommend this item
Love it just wish I would have bought the bigger one. Works great!

It is awesome.
Very good quality
Good size for two person .
Save electricity.
Good value
Even for just one person. It’s too small portion. The brand is good. But the size isn’t right. My mistake

reviews.reviewTitle: Super cute gadget and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: My husband who never cooks anything loves it because he can just toss his food in and it cooks it very quickly . I have the dark gray color and I must say it’s super cute on the counter! I have purchased three for friends

reviews.reviewTitle: So good, my mom just ordered one.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use. Compact.
Love this product, easy to use and really cooks great ..

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, cute appliance, & good price
reviews.reviewText: Got this for my bestfriend for her wedding shower! Love the blue appliances, super cute and I hope she uses it as much as I use mine!

reviews.reviewTitle: Trade in in before warranted to recouped basket wear!
reviews.reviewText: Chrispy outside but not always done on inside. Agree corners of baskets non stick coating basket comes off quickly on clean. Dont dare wipe hard but washer ok as stated.

This appliance works very well. Food is crispy never greasy and takes less time than cooking in the oven. Plus you save a lot on energy bill. We have even tried meat in it and it never dried out. Food tastes delicious.

Brand new, right out of the box, plugged in (a working socket) and just straight up does not work. Will not turn on at all, completely unresponsive. From the sounds of the other reviews, I guess this is just a luck of the draw product, you might get a functional one, you might not.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved using it was so easy and no mess
reviews.reviewText: Was a little small
I absolutely love this..I cook so much in it...omg they cook the best fries!! And cooks even ...so worth the money
Just so-so. Took much longer to cook raw fries than the recipes stated.
I have a T-fal fryer and purchased this one hoping for the best. Bingo it put the T-fal to shame. For the price I will have to give it a thumbs up.

Great Color, refreshing the kitchen! It works more like mini oven than a flyer to me. New way of less oil, healthier cooking! Love it. However, it takes quite bit of time for raw meat cooking, and good for maximum 2 servings.
Love the fryer, but the non stick coating of the grill plate peels very quickly...
Was cheaper with coupon at kohls
Love it easy to use
Me encantó!
I love this machine! It's perfect for 1 or 2 people.
Way smaller than I expected and after following directions and retrying multiple times my sweet potatoes fries never came out good. Same as chicken. Very disappointed.
I got it home and it was broken. Cheaply made product, it's worth spending $30 more for a better one.
The tray needs some extra elbow strength to clean the crevices
It doesnt really work as a expected..quite disappointment.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: rReturned.
Its ok . Just not used to it yet
Awesome
Does what it is supposed to do. Highly recommend.
Does what it is supposed to do. Highly recommend.

This little gem does exactly what you want it to do. Mozzarella sticks, wings, pizza snacks, come out perfectly. Takes a little while to find out just how long to do each snack, but once you get used to it, just perfect. Not for large amounts, but for one or two people its great. Takes up very little space.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Stopped working within a month, waste of money

I knew this was smaller than most (Dash products always are but are still great) but I was surprised how many french fries this does at one time!! We love it and have been using it non stop!! Doesnt heat up kitchen and compact size and beautiful mint color!!
This was a gift the recipient is completely happy with it.loves the,retro color.

This Air Fryer is fantastic. It saves me from having to turn on the oven and heat up the kitchen just to cook some frozen fries, etc. It cooks quickly and gets the food very crispy. It is very compact in size (about the same size as our coffee maker) and so it doesn't take up too much room on the counter. There are just 2 of us in our family, so the size is perfect. If you have a larger family, you would want to purchase a larger one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great size when cooking for one.
reviews.reviewText: I am an old lady, a widow and a non-cook. It is hard to cook meals for one person, you don't want to spend much time on them. but you want good tasting, nourishing meals. I was surprised at how easy the Air Fryer was to learn. I am now using it to make all sorts of good things. The biggest plus is that it is easy to clean. That I love, because my husband was my dishwasher. :) I have actually enjoyed learning this new way of preparing food. With my Instant Pot, Air Fryer and Microwave, I can have a well-balanced meal ready in 12-20 minutes. Love this machine.

My wife and I are very impressed with this air fryer. It is a lot better than microwaving our food. It heats very nicely. You do have to stop and check it and shake it so it browns evenly. Since it's only 2 of us, we bought the small unit. Now I wish we bought one a little bigger size than the 1.2. One thing you want to make sure that the rubber bumper on the side doesn't come off. I didn't realized when I washed it that it came off and my spouse found it in the dish drainer. At first he didn't know what it was. Almost toss it out.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: A hair dryer would work better than this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Teflon coating peeling off onto cooked food and Air Fryer cannot be used again.
reviews.reviewText:
I was approved on 10/30/18 to return this to Amazon after the return by date had come and gone, however,
I didn't realize I had only 14 days to return it in by.

I was out of town and the expiration date expired when I was back and return to send it back for a credit refund.
Now I am STUCK with a defective air fryer that I cannot use because of the DANGER of the black coating getting on my food.

I NEED TO GET ANOTHER RETURN APPROVAL AGAIN so I can return the said merchandise.
SOMEONE PLEASE CONTACT ME IMMEDIATELY SO I CAN GET THIS MATTER HANDLED IN A SATISFACTORY

reviews.reviewTitle: Serious Health concern! Read before you buy.
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Thought it was great at first. Did what it said and more. Two weeks into use on salmon I noticed a lot of black stuff on the fish. Teflon delamination in sheets off the basket contaminating all my food. Threw out my meal and am sending it back. Hope to find something of better quality so I don't get poisoned by China junk. Sad.

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for.
reviews.reviewText:
I am a one-person household, so this air fryer is the perfect size for me. If I had a large family, however, I would consider buying one with a larger basket. This cooks items perfectly with virtually no oil. I use coconut oil spray inside of mine to prevent sticking, and it works great. After using this only 4-5 times, and following the cleaning instructions from the manual, the non-stick surface on the removable part of the basket is chipping off.

UPDATE 11/13/18: The majority of the non-stick surface on the basket is chipping off and was starting to get on my food (eek), however, Amazon is sending me a replacement. Will use it for a little while and then report back if this one chips too.

UPDATE 7/15/19: The basket in the replacement that Amazon sent is chipping, after 8 months of use. I'm not sure if the newer model has a better coating or not, but I wouldn't recommend buying this if you plan on using it regularly.

I don't often write a review but this one deserves some comments. The air fryer had been recommended to me because I'm looking for something for a small space. Had no idea how to use one when I first got it. Everything I looked at was so huge until I found this model which is small and compact. I read all the reviews because I do put a lot of value in what others have experienced both positive and negative. It took some getting used to, but I'm having a lot of fun buying Frozen items to try out. I find it works much like a small tiny toaster oven as well, I've made salmon fillets as well as seasoned fries, jalapeno poppers, and miscellaneous small fried items. I have yet to add any oil at all even though I bought a small oil spritzer to use. It takes a little getting used to it as I said, experimenting with times and temperatures but I'm getting the hang of it. Fits perfectly in a small space I had intended in a camper. I'm having a lot of fun with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: VERY CONVENIENT FOR ONE PERSON!/SEE UPDATE 12/25/18
reviews.reviewText:
This is very small and just what I needed. I haven't done very much cooking since my husband started using a feeding tube a few years ago and frankly tired of prepared meals, an occasional hot dog, burger or take out. So thought I would give this a try. It is just enough for one person and have used it twice since buying it. Cooks everything perfectly and I love the browning on the outside of the meat and chicken. I rub it all down with olive oil and spices before cooking, but that's a personal choice. It's very easy to use, cleans up very easily and a very attractive appliance

for my kitchen countertop. I need to buy a cookbook specifically for air frying. My guesstimates are pretty good, but still need a book with everyday easy recipes. I would recommend it for ONE person cooking.

UPDATE 12/25/18:
TWO ISSUES...First is the handle already feels somewhat loose, Second It is very hard to see the button for the timer, without getting right on top of it. The cooking hasn't changed, so I will stay with a 4 star review for now at least.

I needed something to prepare food in that allowed me to cut down on the amount of cooking oil I used and this little beauty does exactly that. The size I ordered is perfect for preparing french fries or other fried foods for two people. It is easy to clean too. One of the things I like most is that the outside of the fryer does not get hot to the touch during use. Two things I don't like is that the timer isn't exact in measuring the cooking time...it's sort of like a spring-operated time that you turn to indicate the length of time to cook. And since this seems to be a spring-operated time, there's no really way to turn off the timer if your food gets done earlier than expected. The way it is, you have to just let the fryer timer finish winding down until it shuts itself off. One suggestion - pre-heat the fryer for 3-5 minutes for better performance.

I had to be talked into getting this fryer because I didn't think I'd need it, with a microwave/convection oven and a George Foreman indoor grill. But I got talked into it by some health-conscious friends and family members, and I'm glad I got it.

I cooked two marinated chicken breasts in 15 minutes (after 3 minutes of preheating the machine), and they turned out great -- cooked to perfection inside and a healthy (not breaded) crust outside. Tender and delicious! And the machine is easy to clean -- just wash the cooking basket and grill plate in warm soapy water. They supposedly are top-shelf dishwasher safe, but I think, since they have a nonstick surface, they will last longer with handwashing. This model is big enough for two chicken breasts or a couple of servings of veggies. The booklet that comes with it offers information on cooking times for a variety of foods, including eggs and waffles, which I wouldn't use it for. Still, it'll be fun to see what recipes I can create with it.

So far I've made sweet potato fries, onion rings, and wings with this, and everything has tasted great. It's compact, so it doesn't take up much space in the kitchen. I also love that it's dishwasher safe...that's a must for me!

reviews.reviewTitle: It is very straight forward and easy enough for a younger teen to use
reviews.reviewText: I have been considering purchasing an air fryer for about a year and decided to try this one. It is very straight forward and easy enough for a younger teen to use, which is partially why I purchased it. We made the Pickle Chips and Sweet Potato Fries recipes from the air fryer booklet, and some frozen chicken nuggets with great success. Everything was fast , healthier than frying, and delicious. Clean up was a breeze. It was nice to not have to fire up the oven. This appliance is attractive enough to leave out on the counter if you so desire. Buy the Aqua. It is beautiful!

I don't understand why a small 6" basket for air frying needs to be an appliance that is big,tall, and bulky. It is a retro design so that may be part of it but I find it difficult to air-fry fries in a single layer in this space. I have tried (raw) sweet potatoes and half the fries came out undone so I had to pick out the fried pieces and re-fry the undone pieces (not good).
My second try was with baby potatoes which I halved and they all fried up nicely in 15 minutes (at 360-400). I cook for one so I have the luxury of failing but I am 50/50 on this convenience. I don't have much space in my kitchen so I'll have to try chicken wings on my third try and see if they are a game changer. I also want to add that the smell of the air-fry process is chemical-like and not appetizing like oven roasting. I've washed and rewashed the internal basket but the smell lingers. Just be aware of this! Another reason for me not to keep this...

I read a lot about these air frying. I wasn't expecting miracles but I thought they were more like regular oil friers. In contrast, they are more like oven since it's basically a heat source with a fan. I didn't like how they potatoes and onion ring came out, very dry and burn on top too. Therefore I returned it.

We have not had it long but we've been on a tear of experimental airfrying. A 25 year tradition of Friday night fish fry takeout may be at an end - that's how good a fish fry is in this. And that's from frozen breaded cod & steak fries, not from a home recipe.! Sizzling, really hot, fast, flavorful - that's how everything comes out. The size is really good for 1 or 2 people. If for 2, the size is good for one item in a varied meal but is too small for multiple items unless you don't mind keeping one person's plate warm while the other one cooks. The only thing tried so far that isn't done justice are potstickers - they come out with the dough a little tough & browned all over. They are much better with the traditional shallow steam fry method that produces a crispy brown bottom & a top dough that is a soft hot pillow encasing a moist filling. But breaded shrimp, seasoned tofu cubes, clam cakes, crunchy chickpeas, hashbrowns & fries, apple pie bites made with refrigerated biscuit dough and on and on -so good! So easy & fast to cook & clean up!

I love fried foods but I do not like greasy food. This air fryer does a great job of making food taste fried without oil. It's distinctly only sized for one person, or two very very small eaters. I put a boneless chicken breast in and it took up all the room. It makes GREAT chicken wings (though it can only fit 4 wing parts unless you stack them which I think would not be good). I've found that for some foods like fries and wings, lightly spraying something like peanut oil on the food gives it a little bit of a punch up on crispiness and browning. I bought an oil sprayer and put peanut oil in it and now my wings and fries come out great using only a scant bit of oil. I made a parmesan chicken breast recently and sprayed both sides with olive oil spray and it came out beautifully. I've burned several things though so be careful and watch it closely. It's very easy to clean, doesn't take up space and cooks very quickly. Definitely recommend for a single person., but not for 2 unless you are just heating fries.

I have never used an air fryer before but decided I really wanted one. The price on this unit was amazing. It is made for smaller amounts of food. Example, I can fit a small amount of frozen fries and one frozen fish filet. So far I've cooked frozen unbreaded tilapia, breaded fish, frozen french fries, frozen tater tots, home made cream cheese wontons. I'm very impressed with how quickly it has cooked verything and how the food has turned out. Clean up is a breeze. The basket comes out and has a removable grate in the bottom. It is non stick. It can go in the dishwasher but literally takes a minute to squirt dish soap in the bottom, add hot water and scrub yourself. I plan on buying more to give as gifts. Very happy with purchase and I am picky.

reviews.reviewTitle: O. K. Product, but not more than 3 stars.
reviews.reviewText: Does a decent job, but the timer control is hard to turn if your hands are wet or at alcl slick. I saw this exact item at Sam's Club yesterday for $40.00. Here's a little hack to solve the timerr knob issue. I put three wide rubber bands around the knob. (The kind they put around a stalk of celery at the grocery store.) It makes the knob easy to turn with wet hands. See picture.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for those who like fried foods AND their health
reviews.reviewText:
I LOVE fried foods but I have to watch what I eat for health reasons, so among other changes I've had to make to my diet, fried everything had to go. I can still eat some of what I used to, it just has to be seasoned and cooked a different way. This handy thing made the BEST roasted potatoes with almost no oil in probably half the time as it usually takes to bake them, and I didn't have to turn the oven on which is a huge plus for me with my old dinosaur-stove. I also used it for onions, mushrooms, and various other vegetables which also worked well, and eggplant, which did not come out great (dry and rubbery so I just tossed in to some spaghetti sauce) but eggplant can be tricky no matter how you cook it.

Perfect for 1 or 2 people or someone who doesn't have a lot of space for bulky appliances, being that it's around the same size as a food processor or blender, and it's a breeze to clean. It's plastic (doesn't get hot in the outside) but seems of decent quality. I don't use it every day or even once a week, and I'm very careful about how I wash the basket and pan, so I'm hoping it'll last a good long while.

This is my second compact Dash air fryer. When I bought the first, I was new to air frying and chose the model with presets for different foods. After a few uses, I stopped using the presets since I felt my food was getting overdone. This one was purchased to keep at work to reheat food (our toaster oven died and we have not replaced it). What a difference in sound levels! My old one sounded like a plane was coming in for a landing. This one is pleasantly quiet. I'm not sure if the food heats more evenly as I am using it for a smaller range of foods than I use it for at home. I am able to avoid going to the break room to clean it out every use by putting my leftovers on a small square of of parchment paper when reheating. My only issue is I keep overshooting the minutes I am trying to dial and have to roll the dial back. Overall I am pleased I was able to get this on a "warehouse deal." It was labelled "acceptable" and I'd consider this a "very good" buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, clean, decent results, Chef approved!
reviews.reviewText: I'm a pastry chef and I approve of this product for at home use. I wanted to have an at-home fryer, that is compact, suitable for a household of 2. This is super easy to use, attractive in design, nice array of color choices, and best of all does justice to mimicking a fried food consistency without the crazy oil splatter cleanup and enables a healthy option for everyday consumption. It is not necessary to drizzle fat on top of food items, although that is up to the user if they want more moisture added. Great for the price bracket of any fryer and takes up very little room. If you have a larger household or you prefer healthier portions, the larger size would be ideal. This is perfect for small households of 2. Also, no digital or touch screen panel seems to reduce the likelihood of this machine going down. If you work in the food world, equipment that is non commercial grade goes down fast and this seems to have the potential for long term use.

I love this little guy. It’s so easy to use and the food comes out great. And surprisingly you can get two servings from it but I wouldn’t recommend it for more than two people. All in all a great product for the money! I bought two more of them for relatives. The only reason I didn’t give it five stars it is because it’s slightly difficult to push the basket back in, but that seems to be the case with all the air fryers. They need to work on that issue. Maybe have a pushbutton release or swing out basket.

This air fryer didn't impress me at all. I only tried to make french fries, but I was so unhappy with them that I just threw them out. Not even edible. I really didn't expect the fries to be like actual deep fried french fries, but I did expect them to be similar to the oven fries I make, which take 45 minutes or so to bake. I thought this might be a quick alternative. But no. Not good. I had to keep adding time, I did shake the basket midway through as the manual said to. The potatoes were very limp with a few sort of browned spots, they tasted terrible. I think I will donate it to thrift store. Really can't spare the space in my kitchen for such a useless gadget. It wasn't hard to use or hard to clean, just didn't do a good job of "frying".

reviews.reviewTitle: A nice new way to prepare fried food without the guilt.
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer seems to work very nicely. I have found 380 degrees F to be the ideal setting for temperature and leave it set there. It still needs a small amount of oil to properly fry food but that amount is already included in frozen foods intended for oven baking. Foods fried in this machine are still a bit higher in calories than simple baked food but I prefer the crispness achieved in this cooker. A little experimentation is needed for each food prepared this way since the instructions for most foods do not consider this new cooking method. Cooking times required for everything I have tried are several times the time needed for deep frying or pan frying in oil. Cleanup is a bit easier than frying in oil since you don't have all that used oil to dispose.

I kept hearing about air-fryers but really had no interest, I had bought another counter-top kitchen item and this showed up in my recommended list and I decided at this price what the heck. Boy am I glad. I have not tried making my own FF yet but I have used it for frozen popcorn, and tempura shrimp and sweet potato fries and it cooked them all perfectly. No fuss, no muss. Supper easy clean-up. Even got a box of frozen fried pickles and they came out perfect. Now I am going to buy another one for my daughter and still another for a friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Air Fryer but sometimes difficult to guess how much to fry
reviews.reviewText:
We use this product usually for heating up left overs or frozen fries.

We baked wings and finished them in the air fryer (probably only 6-7 at a time) and they did great.

We've also used it for heating up frozen french fries and that was not as easy. I think we put too much in so after the 2nd session w/ the fries, we emptied about 1/2 out and tried again in smaller batches that worked a bit better but they still didn't get crispy.

Heating up food works great as well as finishing off wings/chicken after its been baked but Idk if I'd recommend trying to use it on french fries (unless somebody found a trick that I haven't found yet!) haha

reviews.reviewTitle: Great appliance but you must follow the directions
reviews.reviewText: First of all, I live by myself so I thought the smaller one would work just fine. But I wish I had purchased a bigger size. That being said, you do have to follow the directions. Mainly I would say: be sure to preheat for a few minutes before adding food to be cooked, don't forget to "stir" or shake the food, and be sure to spray the food with oil. I made sweet potato fries, and potato chips, as well as reheated some frozen potatoes. I don't use it all that much but am glad to have it. My friend says it looks like a Minion so now we call it the Minion.

I really didn't expect to like this little fryer, a friend's wife talked me into getting one. I own the Breville Smart Oven Air and have used it for air frying, but unless I'm making a lot of something it's a lot to heat up and use. As I live alone and usually only cook for 1-3 people, I discovered this little fryer was perfect. For such as fries, tater tots, chicken wings, chicken thighs and even fried eggs, it's worked perfectly. I really like the simplicity, with only a timer knob and a temp knob. I know this 'Dash' brand is something new, but I also own and enjoy their little egg cooker that I've used a lot over the last 2 years without trouble. I can put this little fryer away in a cabinet; most of them are much larger and have to sit out all the time. Have had no issues and no problems over dozens of uses.

This thing is amazing! I leave it on the counter because I use it so often. I bought it as a present and didn't think I was going to really use it at all, but it's so simple to use with great results. You just dump a bag of chicken tenders or fries in the basket and set the timer. You don't need to add any oil or additional ingredients. I usually shake it up half way through. In 10 or 15 minutes, you get crispy, tasty food! Amazing

This is a small air fryer at a nice price. I was curious about air fryers and didn’t want a serious commitment. The Dash fryer works fine! It cooks frozen appetizer treats ... cheese sticks, fries, chicken nuggets, etc, quickly and well. It doesn’t hold a lot but that suits two adults who don’t need a lot of “fried food snacks.” I’ve used it also to reheat/toast breakfast items. I’m sure it can be used for more if one were interested. It’s a convection oven with a round footprint! It’s easy to clean. It’s also lightweight, so storing it in a cupboard is no effort.

reviews.reviewTitle: POISON! Don't use this unless you want to die!
reviews.reviewText: Teflon coating is cancerous. Thanks for putting this in my food in the first month of use. Several others have also complained about this issue. Oh, it didn't work very well either, except on chicken wings. But now I want to throw up everytime I think about the fact i was probably eating some teflon coating with my wings. Ugh. Hey Amazon, stop selling this thing before you all get sued.
Small but good enough for 1-2 servings. There was an instant chemical-like smell when I opened my package. After 3 uses the smell is still going strong. Not expecting to use this again.

At one year, the nonstick coating is peeling off the bottom of the basket holder. This is not where food ever touches, so that's a mystery. I use parchment on the basket itself so that part is fine.

This is perfect for one or two people with a small kitchen. I love it and use it often. However, the coating coming off concerns me.

Kale chips take about 3 minutes (vs. 12 in the oven)
Fries or onion rings take about 7 minutes.
I recommend getting the book Air Fryer Every Day. It's pretty much perfect.

Overall, I would recommend this product, but wish the manufacturer did a better job with the nonstick coating.

Great little machine. And it is little. Good for one or two people. I was like a kid in a candy store last night trying this thing out. Mini quiche, tots of various veggies (cauli, potato and sweet potato). Having less in the machine definitely makes for a quicker cooking time. I'm still looking up all the various recipes and look forward to trying things out. Would love to hear if anyone has managed to double up in this machine (it's a bit small for two burgers to fit side by side - would they go one on top of the other?). I think the manufacturer would make a packet selling a stacking insert.

This "air fryer" is critical to our family now. It is more of a "roaster" than "fryer", but either way, it cooks beautifully. chicken, salmon, french fries, frozen chicken cordon bleu, all come out great. It has hot air blasting onto the food which gives the food a great crunch and roasted flavor. Melts the fat off of chicken legs and breast skin, to have crispy skin remaining -- a weakness -- and the meat is very moist and delicious. Would not want to be without microwave and without the air fryer -- and the cost of the unit is an exceptionally great bargain. It's paid for itself many times.

It is a bit small, but it works great! The basket can hold a whole large sweet potato's worth of fries no problem. With some practice and the right recipe its amazing, and its great for reheating leftovers. I've used a fancier model, but for the price, I really can not find any problems with it. I bought a refurbished model and it looks and works like new

I purchased this for use after my weight loss surgery and I’m so happy I did! I use this 3 times a day and love it! I can only eat small amounts so when I cook a recipe makes 5-10 servings. The Dash air fryer heats up my meals perfectly. It cooks fish to perfection. Vegetables are wonderful. It even reheats my omelets! It’s perfect for me! That said here’s the BUT-if I had a normal size stomach this would be too small. It would never work for two people. So if you’ve had weight loss surgery get one! If you have not then get an air fryer just not this small one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Insert chipped & rusting after a few months
reviews.reviewText: Worked great for a couple months. Now the sides are warping & the grease tray has chipped, the Teflon is gone & bare metal exposed which is now rusting.

The fryer is absolutely lovely but please note that it’s a lot smaller than it looks and is described. It’s fine if it’s for a single person or if you have limited counter space person but not ideal for preparing meals for larger families. It’s sturdy and the color (I purchased the red one) is pretty. It’s just really small.

reviews.reviewTitle: A good air fryer at a good price. Makes a good gift and is reliable.
reviews.reviewText: I like that it came with a recipe book, and simple cleaning instructions. I think other models have more power( get hotter) but this works really well. It might take a few minutes longer to cook something, but it really is worth it, it comes out very good. So far we have made amazing onion rings and things like that. I highly recommend this product. I feel very comfortable using it. Just remember, like all air fryer units it must have a good amount of room around it for air to circulate. I feel safe using it, it never gave off any funny smells or tastes to the food. Just like the instructions say, while frying things you should pull out the drawer and shake it about half way through. Feels solid, safe and effective and we'll priced. Highly recommend. Also is attractive sitting on a countertop. Makes a great gift, is healthy and fun to use.

I made Tyson frozen blackened chicken strips from frozen. no preheating about 12 mins for 5 tenders at 400 and they are crispy all around with no turning. I am doing weight watchers (in 7 weeks lost14 lbs, 7 to goal) and these are zero points! I went to Popeyes and these are better with more seasoning and crispy which theirs are not. I had a couple larger air fryers of QVC brand and they sent a letter that they catch fire so I tossed. I live in a compact travel trailer half the year and this will help save space and weight! Great product and ez to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuts cook time, clean up quick
reviews.reviewText: I love the compact size of this unit depending on how much you eat it is perfect for one person two meals . Very easy to clean and store. My local grocery makes meat balls and I just purchased those put 4 in the unit for 10 minutes and they come out perfectly. I'm going to try chicken next I'll let you know if I find anything less than perfect. I bought the large 6 qt insta pot and this is superior as far as being a single person and easy to use I prefer this unit. I love my kitchen. I love to cook. This just cut my time in half, cleaning and cooking.

We've never had an air fryer and decided to try Dash compact. We've now been using it for a couple of months and are very pleased. We're still trying out recipes but have used it with delicious results cooking french fries, brussel sprouts, corn on the cob, okra, kale chips, and potato chip. It's reliable, easy to clean, and is compact. Nice product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Functions well, but the food sticks to the tray.
reviews.reviewText: It functions fine, but the rubber stoppers on the tray came off on the first washing and one went down the drain before I could catch it, so now I worry about scratching the inside of the food basket. Food sticks to the tray like crazy - so while I love the flavor and reduced fat of cooking this way, the cleanup take way long than it should to get food out of the little round holes in the tray. Good size for just one or two people, but not near big enough for a family.

reviews.reviewTitle: i absolutely LOVE this air fryer
reviews.reviewText: i absolutely LOVE this air fryer! i don't think i have ever used a kitchen appliance more! anything that i used to fry, bake or grill, now goes into this air fryer. it is the perfect size for 1-2 servings and my food comes out perfect each time. it is easy to clean, which was one of my fears when shopping for an air fryer. french fries, jalapeño poppers, and wings are my favorite thing to make in this so far, but i have also made a meat loaf, stuffed chicken breasts, burgers, pork chops, and many more. meats come out juicy every time!

reviews.reviewTitle: EASY to use and perfect sized
reviews.reviewText: I just started using air fryers and the first one I had was way too big. The second cracked (both purchased elsewhere) and now I have this compact unit. It's perfect for a single household or probably even a couple. I just love that it's smaller and not too heavy to pick up and put away. Clean up was easy. The only thing is you have to wait until the unit and the pan portion cool down. You cannot clean the pan portion until it's cool or you will damage it.

I really like this Air Fryer for the money. It is small but perfect for one or two people. I took off a star because of the recipes in the book. Not many and not healthy ones. They should have done a much better job of giving ideas of things to cook. I have tried a couple of them and I didn't like either.
