I am trying to look online but it would be nice to have the correct temperature for this fryer rather than having to guess the temp and how long to cook..

reviews.reviewTitle: Lacks the power it needs to compete with a larger unit.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I had a larger one by another manufacturer and it was awesome and we loved it..but my husband dropped it on the floor so when we replaced it I elected for this one because of its size but by comparison to our original one it loses in every category. It wont even toast a muffin properly much less a chicken breast. I have been tempted to just throw this thing in the trash and give up on it but its still somewhat new and I feel wasteful just trashing it...even if that is where it needs to go.

I bought this for my camper. I have a larger model for my house and this little works just as well as the larger model! I love that it comes in fun colors and it super lightweight. Perfect for cooking just for 2!

reviews.reviewTitle: The handle came off. Otherwise I LOVE THIS AIR FRYER!!
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I love the color, I love the size, and I absolutely LOVE this hot air fryer so much! But only had it 2 months and the handle fell off. I’m going to try to glue it back on but I had to lower the rating for the handle’s poor manufacturing flaw. I would buy this fryer again in a heartbeat short of this one important flaw. Hey Amazon, since I’m a Amazon buying addict (look at my purchase records AckK!) would y’all consider sending me replacement piece for free?? It’s hard to remove the food with no handle attached.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best affordable air fryer out there
reviews.reviewText: I use my Dash Air Fryer almost daily since I bought it and have had little to no issues with it. When it first arrived, I cleaned the machine and noticed it still had a strong odor in the frying compartment. The first couple of times I air fried, the food would smell and taste like the strong chemical odor it first came with. I don't have that issue anymore today, but it was very off-putting for the first day and I almost returned it. It's been amazing other than that issue. It's easily taken apart and cleaned and 'fries' food perfectly. You kind of have to play around with the temperature and how long you're cooking items for but once you get it, it gets the job done!

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing makes the best baked sweet potatoes!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this air fryer earlier this year and have made French fries and some roasted veggies. The day I received it, I made some herb roasted baby potatoes and they came out just as I imagined, crispy with a perfectly creamy interior. I tried their recipe for sweet potato French fries with less success (I haven't given up). But the real magic happened when I baked whole sweet potato. If you ever tried it, you'd agree that they are the best. I'm hooked!!!

It's very compact and easy to store, but it's out a lot because I'm using it a lot. I recently decided to try making jerky. So far, I've made both beef and chicken jerky and am very pleased with the results. Using the low temperature setting, the jerky turned out perfect. Other things I've tried also exceeded my expectations. It is very small, but I needed a small one because of limited storage space. Overall, I am very happy with this choice.

UM YES! My friends had an air fryer that was so confusing. This one cooks the food perfectly. For example - my family loves wings. Cooking them in the oven would take 1.5-2 hours to get them crispy but pop them in the air fryer for 15 minutes and they’re just as good if not better. I have made countless recipes in this and it has saved me so much time, not to mention a lot less clean up. This is a steal - super cheap and an amazing product. I know these are popular as gifts now tol

I love my air fryer, and I LOVE that the basket and tray are DISHWASHER SAFE! I can’t even tell the difference from air frying to actual frying and this is so easy to use. I love that I don’t have to heat my house up with my oven in the middle of summer if I want something that I could pop in my air fryer instead.

This is definitely only for 1-2 servings though. I’d get a bigger fryer if you’re wanting to make a large batch for more than 1-2 people.

This worked like a charm. Until it didn’t. Five months after purchase, I tried to cook my favorite item, a chicken breast. When I turned it over at the halfway point the meat was barely warm. The only thing working on the fryer is the timer! And of course, it’s too late to return it or get a refund so I guess the only mild consolation here is that I bought the smallest size on sale, so my loss is relatively painless (but still annoying!). Damn. What a disappointment.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very small. The tray pops out but kind or ...
reviews.reviewText: Very small. The tray pops out but kind or hard to get the holes clean. Very cute ... a piece of pizza won’t fit on this

This is a nice and compact with small footprint compared to other air fryers that are almost double the size of this one. Perfect for tight spaces. Biggest difference is that there is no separate basket inside. Instead, there is a disk with holes on bottom that raises food, and I assume, allows hot air to flow underneath. Easy to use with simple time and temp dial. Works well compared to other popular brands.

My daughter moved into a dorm 'suite' setup which has a full kitchen. I wanted to gift her with a healthier way to enjoy the fried foods she loved and thus purchased the Dash Compact Air Fryer for her for less than forty dollars during Prime Days.

The first night with her roommates she made them french fries with this air fryer and they all loved them! Fresh, crispy and healthier than traditional deep frying. The 1.2L capacity was enough for two people, but she said she might need another one if all 4 of them were eating together.

Product works very well. If one wants couple of steaks, baked potato, and maybe chicken, this product is really not for them. It is a smaller than many other air fryers, but can make everything from tator tots to doughnuts. I like this machine quite well. For just two people in home, it's perfect! I've noticed heat directions in the fryer cookbook is a little on the warm side. Do have to keep eye on the temperature and cooking.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super easy to use for one - two people
reviews.reviewText:
Love this item. Love the seafoam green color. Purchased it because I wanted to try an air fryer without paying a lot to see if we liked it. It is great. Be sure to shake zucs and softer items so they don't stick. Super easy to clean by just wiping it down or using a little dishwashing soap. So far the coating has stayed strong and everything tastes great.
Will probably purchase a larger one a little later and take this one to our summer fixer-upper.

This is the first time I have ever had an air fryer and it's absolutely wonderful! No more using bottles and bottles of oil to deep fry something, just put it in the air fryer, and you have nice crispy food! You can't tell the difference between air fried and deep fried except with deep fried, its more greasy. One drawback though, this air fryer is a little small. It's manageable however because I cook for one-myself! Otherwise, it's a good, good, product and worth the money for it.

I had previously had a chefman, which broke, and thought I’d try this one as a replacement. Man, do I miss my old air fryer. This one smells kinda weird and it doesn’t crisp quite as well as the chefman. The food always tastes a bit odd to me. So now it sits in a top, unreachable shelf in my kitchen. Definitely regret buying this product. :(

As an older person, I really appreciate the ease of use of this fryer. No confusing LED screens! The food comes out crisp and wonderful. I roast asparagus, cauliflower, carrots... in my little fryer and they all do great. I cook chicken, and steaks in it too. I will take it on long trips in my RV next year. It has proven itself worth of the precious space in my tiny home on the road.
I use this all the time. I live by myself so it is the perfect size.everything I have has come out excellent. breaded chicken breast, french fries,and fish are all great.

I've only cooked french fries and a turkey burgers in it so far. I used only a tiny bit of oil, but overall the food tastes good with a bit of seasoning added. The only problem I have with it is the limited amount of cooking instructions in the book, because there aren't many options. And you only get a 'time range' (9-16 min) so you'll have to eventually figure out the amount of time you want your food cooked by trial and error.

Outstanding value for the price. Love it for quick reheats, chicken comes out great, and air fried cauliflower bites are delicious! My grandkids love it because it make their pizza rolls and other quick snacks light and crispy, way better than the microwave and safer than letting kids use the stove or oven. Love it!

This air fryer is junk. I have used it for many different items and recipes trying to give it the benefit of doubt. All food items burn on the outside and stay raw and cold inside. Also, the basket to use for cooking is tiny. Fits roughly 1 hamburger patty inside. I wish I had read more honest reviews before ordering, but I was so excited because of how cheap it was. Haha jokes on me.

This fryer works great and is small enough to fit on my counter. Just perfect for people that only want to make one or two servings.

I wrote this less than a year ago. I have used it about once a week since then and it works great, but now the basket coating is peeling off and the basket handle is threatening to fall off. It should last longer than this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ideal air fryer for 4 people family
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this air fryer for 2 months.
I want to decrease oil while cooking for my family and I am very pleased with this air fryer. It doesn’t have a lot of smell while it is working except when I make pork bacon.
I use it almost every day.
With the reasonable price and not big on my countertop, I refer to my friends.
I like this appliance so much.

reviews.reviewTitle: I had no idea how good air-fried stuff can be.
reviews.reviewText: I really like this little thing. It consumes little power, and cooks enough for me. It does produce more external heat than I expected so make sure you point the back vent towards nothing it can hurt/melt. It's capacity is too small for a large group/family, but is perfect for a single person or small family. My experience is with fries, and I think it's great that I don't need to heat up oil to get a fried effect. I'll be trying chicken strips next.

reviews.reviewTitle: Became my favorite cooking implement overnight
reviews.reviewText: I love how easy it it is to use, how it crisps my food without oil or a mess or needing my attention, how easily it cleans, that it turns itself off when the food compartment is pulled out, and that I do not have to plug and unplug it. And it's super cute looking too with that aqua color. Adds pizzazz to my entire kitchen. Someone really put a lot of thought into designing it and I appreciate that.

I crave crispy and salty snacks but didn't like the process. Hot oil splattering, the heavy feeling after when chips are soaked in the oil. It takes some getting used to and you need to check it while you're air frying. But once it's cooked and golden to your preference, it's light, airy and delicious! I've air fried bacon, chicken skin, spring rolls etc. Try it!

This is a perfect gift to those who love crispy food. It’s so easy to use. You just stick the food on the tray, adjust the temperature and turn the timer on and you’re all set.
I’ve been using this to make fried artichokes, crispy kale, broccoli - no oil needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use to own a deep fryer and hated when all of the oil would get on the ...
reviews.reviewText: I've used this air fryer for potatoes, chicken and grilled cheese so far. I use to own a deep fryer and hated when all of the oil would get on the surrounding walls in my kitchen and I also hated having to clean out the old oil. I'm so glad I finally own an air fryer, especially one as nice as this, because it takes less work to clean up and it's healthier with the same crisp that I am use to.

1. It changed the tots taste to extra crispy without the extra fat or heating my whole home with my oven.
2. It's very non-stick but not super slippery
3. Very small space saver.
4. Cooks thinks faster, so when I get home late I don't have to wait for my food to be done, just load it , do my things and come back 15 to 20 minutes later and my food is ready. I would buy this again if anything happens to my current one.

So easy to cook with, easy to clean, and easy to control. I like that it doesn’t have a digital screen (one thing can can’t get damaged by heat!), and features clean knobs instead. I love to toss gyoza in it, or tofu to make it firm and crispy. Lately I have even been putting barbecue jackfruit in there after it is fully prepared, to make the edges crispy (like actual bbq!). And won’t need a microwave for a frozen burrito again!

I REALLY love Dash products; this will make my third one. I also have their mini waffle maker and the egg cooker. I saw other reviewers complaining this was too small... well it says COMPACT in the description. This is perfect for cooking for one or two people and I found the fryer basket to be plenty roomy. The manual comes with some good recipes and I will be trying their sweet potato fries tonight! If you want an air fryer where you can load up enough food for 4-5 people at once, this is not the fryer for you. Again, if you're like myself and just cooking for one or two. The Dash Air Fryer is perfect.

This thing is the bomb! I just got it today and have already made 2 trays of teriyaki wings. Using it was a snap and clean up couldn’t be easier PLUS I didn’t have to heat up the kitchen in this 90+ degree weather. Can’t wait to try lots of recipes. I also could not believe all the grease that dropped off 4 chicken wings. Gotta be healthier

The unit looks great...and seems to work well....but I haven’t been impressed when I use it....things aren’t cooking well...they take way more time than the book says...I wasn’t aware I’d have to keep opening the thing to “shake” the food up....hoping there’s a learning curve and things will improve....

Like the reduced fat intake while still enjoying "fried" foods. No hot oven and easy clean up. Only complaint is that the box was delivered as is. Not in a prime box so that anyone could see exactly what it was and take it. I feel it is no one's business what I purchase and want my purchased protected as much as possible within the shipping/delivery system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well; nice size for one or two people
reviews.reviewText: I'm just learning to use this, but I like it so far. I've cooked chicken tenders and they came out well. (I overcooked the first ones...so you have to watch the time) I also cooked frozen fried shrimp and they came out nicely. Next up is sweet potato fries, so I'm hoping they come out well. This is a smaller unit, so not suitable for family meals, but nice for a single person, or snacks. I like that it only has two knobs -- time and temperature..so it's simple to operate. The basket and rack clean up nicely, too. I just let it cool a bit, and put it in the sink with some hot, soapy water for a few minutes.

Oh my goodness I love this thing! My dream come true, fried stuff without the grease and is healthy. Only suggestion to makers was the time and temp numbers are hard to read. I had to redo them with a sharpie. Not taking a star off for that cause it exceeded my expectations!

Works great! We have cooked several items in this and all have turned out delicious. The fan did make an awful noise when I first used it, I looked into the inside and one of the fan blades was slightly bent... it was easy to bend it back and worked well after that!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for one or two people
reviews.reviewText: This smaller air fryer is great. It seems to be the perfect size for the two of us. Everything we've tried in it has come out perfectly and it's very to clean when you are done. I'd recommend this for a couple of people and while the little book of recipes that comes with it is very good check out some more online it you want to get fancy.

Quit working. It was the perfect size for my needs so I am very disappointed that it quit working already. Have had this two months and used it only four times. Just for cooking frozen ready products. The fourth time I used it, it would not heat up. Barely got warm. Tried again and still does not heat up. No matter how long I leave the food in. Of course I’ve had it 60 days and the return window is 30 Days.

First, how cute is this little appliance, but beyond that, it works like a dream! If you live alone and you are (trying) to eat healthier, get one asap. You will be so happy you did! Easy to use, easy to clean, and it looks darling on my counter. There is not one thing I don't love and I am so pleased with my purchase.
In less than 4 months the handle broke off. Trying to return.

Quick, easy, great idea really. Kicker is that it's only big enough for 1 person. Even if it's a side dish. The other thing to be aware of, is if you do some type of pasta items ( like perogie or ravioli) , the dough while cooked has a different texture and the sauce doesn't like to stick. Does good with other things though.

We love using this thing. Had I known how much use we would get from it, I'd purchased the larger size. But nevertheless, everything we have cooked in it has come out perfectly. And the price is not too bad, compared to some other air fryers out there. Super easy to clean the bin, just pop it in the top rack of a dish washer!

This is so perfect. It took me a couple of tries to get the timing down perfect, but love the clean cooking when your stove is busy with other things. Breaded shrimp and fries were amazing. B-B-Que chicken wings, great and no grease!
Chicken came out tasty. Fries are still a work in progress. Make sure to have nothing behind it when on..I melted my microwave door! As long as you shake for evenness, works perfectly

Not very compact, needs more countertop space than expected. Also need to be moved 6 in from walls or other surfaces when operating.
Other than space needed, works well, after finding out what temps and time are needed, by experiment.
Best description of this machine is "Convection Toaster", not "Air Fryer".

Buy a bigger air fryer. This is great, but unless you want to make one serving of vegetables at a time it’s small. But fabulous little thing. Haven’t had anything bad yet. Cook book isn’t Americanized so you won’t find much in there. But once you get an idea of timing you can cook anything.
I purchased this air fryer as a Christmas gift for my mom. She lives alone now and did not want the large traditional sized air fryer and this one was perfect for her. She loves it.

Primarily I like the ease of use and saving electricity in using the Air Fryer versus an electric stove. As a senior need something to use that is easy and less clean up. Will be used for pork chops, chicken strips, fish sticks, and french fries and steak fries.

Love this for its size, price and most important how it cooks whatever I pu inside. I would tell anyone that is wavering because of the price, go for it. It is the best bargain out there and doesn’t take up a lot of space on the counter.

First my niece, then my sister and finally me: WE ALL HAVE ONE and we like everything about it. Make a toast cheese, hash-browns, big, fat juicy sausages. Better flavor than frying and there's nothing to clean up. Just wipe it with a paper towel and fergetaboutit!

Very good little machine for one or two people! Just have to get used to the cook times.Its very easy to clean! Jus know the directions say when you plug it in the light will come on and that’s not the case you have to start the timer for the light to come on, i thought mine didn’t work until i read the “troubleshoot” manual

Kept hearing about air frying. Saw this item for a reasonable price and decided to see what the hype was about. Does well on fries, decent on chicken strips. No bueno on actual chicken wings. I don't feel compelled to utilize for meats from a raw state. Good for quick snack type 'frying '. Kiddo friendly. Easily cleaned and placed out of the way.

I love my air fryer! This is the easiest thing to use and clean. And when it Cooks the food Cooks it so good and it's still so flavorful and juicy on the inside depending on what you make. So far we have made chicken, chicken wings, hash browns, zucchini and it's all been amazing!

I like it as a bare-bones basic air fryer (mechanical timer, no electronics, just a heat element in a jar). Made me want a bigger, more informative, (shaker alert) and smarter device. Best for bratwurst, hot dogs, breakfast sausage, and tater tots or frozen onion rings.

I made the won ton recipe from the manual. They came out crisp, crunchy and delicious. Then we used it to reheat some lemon chicken from take out, along with some rangoons. Both came out crisp and hot. No more microwave reheating for us.

reviews.reviewTitle: This something I put off buying for a long time....
reviews.reviewText: Then it was on sale. It's not good for everything, but I've made delicious "fried" chicken in it, Tater Tots, fries, potato chips, etc. I will definitely explore it more. The drawback would be that it can cook for no more than two at a time, but there are just two of us, so it's perfect.
Love this thing. Used it 4 times in the first two days. Excellent for fries and tots. Quick and very easy. The sound that it makes when operating is not bothersome at all.

Received May 1 - stopped working September 1

That is all

I bought two, one for my daughter and one for my mother. Both of them are very happy with their air fryers, and busy sharing recipes and showing photos of their air fried cauliflower, brussel sprouts, and corn.

This is a great, fun way to a fast and healthy lifestyle.

Super tiny the radius of the cooking vessel is maybe 5 inches so you can only cook maybe 4 chicken wing pieces at a time maybe if you’re cooking for one that is ok.

The nonstick coating flaked off after the first use so I’m not even sure if it’s safe to cook with anymore.

I absolutely love this little guy. It’s so versatile. I have made onion rings, chicken nuggets, and steak with it. It has made my life so much easier. It’s also the perfect size and portion for single person like me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes a lot of heat in the room
reviews.reviewText:
It appears to cook OK but makes a lot of heat that is transferred to the room. Long cooking times make a lot of heat.
Definitely not and appliance for use in Arizona in the summer time. Will be reserved for french fries.
I love how quick and easy this product is to use. So easy to make a quick delicious meal!

This is my first air-fryer so I wasn't sure what to expect. This model is small so good for one person and small kitchens. I'm still learning the correct time and temps. It's great for wings and fries but tricky for meats and veggies. I was hopeful to be able to toss it in the dishwasher but it doesn't clean well and it discolored the handle of the fry basket.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect size at a great price
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer is perfect for me. I’ve cooked lots of vegetables, tofu in a flash, chicken nuggets. It cooks so quickly and without heating up the house like an oven. I never noticed the plastic smell others have experienced.
It works fine and good for small portions but it has been two weeks.... I can smell plastic when I use it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect size for a small family
reviews.reviewText: Use primarily for french fries and onion rings. Takes a little time to figure out optimal temp and time settings, but well worth it to delete cooking oil from from our food.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good price point,easy to use super easy to clean👍👍👍
reviews.reviewText:
I hate to cook....but I love this air fryer!!!! Must use this 4-5 times a week. Easy to use,fail proof,easy to clean!!!
In hind sight,I prefer seeing digital numbers for cooking temps,but for the price and ease of use it is perfect for the 1-2 person household. Easy peasy for the cooking adverse👍👍👍

reviews.reviewTitle: I’m already in love with this thing!
reviews.reviewText: I had no idea how awesome this thing could be! It’s very simple to use and is ready right out of the box. Cooking is very fast and much healthier than a deep fryer. It’s also very easy to clean. I can’t wait to try more recipes with this!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally an air fryer that doesn't take up my entire kitchen counter!
reviews.reviewText: Most air fryers are gigantic black monsters. This one is compact and very pretty. I got the aqua that has a retro look. I've cooked four things and it woks flawlessly. A+ from me because it works, it's small, it's pretty, cleans fast. The only Con is that I wish it came with a bigger cookbook, but I found lots of websites with recipes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will need to get used to the idea that this is not a mini-oven.
reviews.reviewText: At this time of year the best thing about this air fryer is that you can avoid using your oven or your stove top. Convenient, quick, easy to clean, & stores easily on your countertop if you want to leave it out.

Cooking for one can be a challenge at times. Wanting crispy foods are a real challenge. With the air fryer and 11-15 minutes the challenge is gone. Very good crispy foods and not the grease. Took a little experimenting but totally worth the effort. Highly recommend.

I do like the air fryer. It is good for a single person. However, with a family of more than 2 people, this is too small. I do use it weekly. The grey color matches the rest of my countertop appliances and hence the reason I bought it. Had I really looked into it, I would have bought bigger.
Love this compact fryer. Works wonderfully on fish and chips. Can’t wait to see what else we can fry! Shipped fast and arrived early.

Got this on a whim. However, it works great for fries, Tater tots, etc. so far. No added fat, fast, simple. Easy to use. Great results. Not huge. Best for 1-2 people. Dang, this thing is awesome. Fast, simple, solid.

reviews.reviewTitle: Air fryer works. Recipes in their book,not so much.
reviews.reviewText: Followed the airfryer recipe for sweet potatoes. It took twice as long to cook and they did not turn brown, they turned grey. Either a bad airfryer or a bad recipe! Update. Works great with frozen fries. Just don’t use the recipes in their booklet.

I love it! Took it out of the box and use it that night. It’s larger than I had expected but not an issue. It’s perfect for a one or two person household. I can finally have my favorite fried foods without the oil.
Easy to clean, easy to use, compact and convenient! Not a large basket, more for sides or things for 1 to 2 people. Doesn't take up much counter space and is a pretty color, so there's that.

It is super easy to use. The size is ideal for two people. We honestly love certain typical foods of our country and many of them are fried, so this is incredible because it is all super crispy and without so much fat.

An excellent purchase, we are happy!

We rarely use it because it still requires some oil. The recipes we made without oil such as fries or chicken nuggets, were TERRIBLE. They were rock hard. I'm going to try to use it in the future, but I'm not sure I'll ever be in love with it.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to like this. It worked great until it didn’t. The handle came unscrewed from the tray and there’s no way to screw it back on. I’ve only had it for 6 months. It’s going in the trash and I won’t be buying another dash air fryer again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great but small cooking basket
reviews.reviewText: I love how easy this is to use and clean the only drawback is the basket is small. It takes three and four times to use to make small amounts. Good for someone single but cooking for a family is tedious this small

Size, ease of use. timer with shutoff. small counter footprint, perfect for my single use only to try out. pleased with purchase. arrived quickly, packaged well, sale price was good. ordered accessories at same time.

It's awesome! We use it all the time. We haven't had any issues with it. Set it up, throw your food in, wait a few minutes and voila! it's ready to eat.
It was a great purchase for the amount spent.
It is small so we have to do a couple of batches at a time. If you cook large amounts, get a bigger size.

So far I really like it. I have only done frozen fries and tater tots, but it has worked really well. Just have to remember to keep shaking the basket once in a while. It doesn't heat the place up like the oven, and I can't wait to experiment with it. It could be a little bigger, but for the price I cannot complain.

Perfect for healtier food, no oil needed just a little drops for the fries. i cook a lot of food on this and the only complain that is take longer to cook things than advertise. overall is a great buy.

I like this air fryer because it cooks a lot faster and puts out very minimal heat. It’s more than adequate for 2-3 people. (I got a small one.) I also thinks it improves the taste of food versus oven frying. I would buy it again or for a gift.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why DIdn't You Tell Me Sooner?!?!?!
reviews.reviewText: This is amazing! I haven't fried anything in years because the last time I did, I set a kitchen on fire. This is so quick, safe, and easy! Literally plug-and-play. Just trust me and buy it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Used daily and I love it!
reviews.reviewText:
Works awesome. I love cooking everything in it. Fries to reheated leftovers are as crispy as 1st time cooked. Dont overfill, only small single serve batches for this size..
Air does not circulate underneath so turning over required.
Perfect size and super easy to clean! Love it so much more than my expensive as seen on tv air fryer. I actually have purchased 3 so to keep on hand for last minute gifts!
I like the way that cooks the food without any mess
I really love this item, just the right size for one or two people. I'm going to get my son one for his house, he will love it to, I"m sure.
I ordered this fryer after seeing reviews . I have tried various foods & woohoo--L-U-V- 'em all! I gave my grease fryer away--now I'm eating healthier & it taste great!!
It works fine for small amounts of food. This not the one for anymore that one or two servings. This is my first air fryer and it's just not what I was thinking it was going to be.
I travel a lot and usually have no access to an oven. I ordered this to make cooking meat easy. I also use for frozen potatoes, breads, etc. Easy cleanup

I had such high hopes for this, but alas it stinks. The enclosed recipe booklet isn't even very good! I gave it two stars instead of one because it lived up to one expectation: it's easy to clean.

My kids give this a major thumbs down!

Very disappointed with this. I’ve had it three months and it broke and only used it about four times. Plugged it in one day and it just didn’t turn on I thought maybe it was my electric outlet but no it was air fryer.
Excellent product. I prefer this older model over the newer ones with the digital controls. Great for a fast meal. Can took a perfect steak in about 20 mn at 350 degrees.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Product, Like the rest of the Dash Family!
reviews.reviewText: WIth having the Blender by dash, i knew this product would be the same. And once i opened up the box and looked inside i knew, i would not be disappointed. Keep in mind time and temp will be a time and trial and era. But, once you get those times and temp down, set it and forget it, oil spray before placing product on the grill is very important.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText:
Hande attachment fail
Not built for vigorous shaking
Windows to replace or repair closed
Love the way his air fryer cooks tater tots, egg rolls and other Chinese finger foods, and other frozen finger foods. It's fast and easy and the food is tasty!!
My favorite thing about the fryer is the fact that as a diabetic and single person it's perfect for making meals in a hurry and it fits into my eating plans.

This is a good product but it is difficult to clean when cooking meat. Good gets sick under the bar in the center of the rack which makes it hard to clean. To really clean it you need a brush small enough to get under the bar. The covers on the end of the rack, to protect the basket, come off very easily. I already lost one.

reviews.reviewTitle: As Good as Higher Priced Ones
reviews.reviewText: I have bought 3 of these for my grown children and each of them has loved it. It does what it says it will do and in much quicker time than an oven!
I just wish it was bigger but you get what you pay for. It does exactly what is advertised and easy to use. It's small size is a plus for easy storage

This would be good for a single person. It would take to long to make enough for 3 or more people.
It does a good job with fish sticks and on a small serving of french fries.
The basket and lid are easy to clean.
I wish I would have ordered a larger size but this one is perfect for my camper
I did alot of research before this purchase and Im glad I decided to buy it. Now this isnt for a family. More so for a single person because the portions its holds are not much for 2 or 3 more ppl.
Love the color and the size! Works perfectly! Would’ve preferred it be a little smaller only because I cook for 2. This is more like for a family of 4.

I wanted to buy an air fryer for a couple of years. When I saw this one at this price I thought just go for it. I did not like this. I think my oven does just as good. Maybe I should of spent more on a better one.

I never write reviews on here but I love this thing so much that I thought I should. I am single and I cook everything in it! It’s perfect for one person! I have made tostones, fries, lobster tail and loads of salmon. Everything comes out cooked to perfection and so quickly! I love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product/save your money and use your toaster oven
reviews.reviewText: I have never used an air fryer before. Thought it would some how make the food taste crispier than the oven. It takes just as long for fries and taste and texture is the same as if I was to use my oven. If I could go back I would not have purchased.

I don't know why I waited so long to get an air fryer. Now I wish I would have got the larger one! We love using this for our fries and the kids love their chicken nuggets in it. This size is perfect if just making enough for 2 people so we usually have to make two batches.
I would not recommend purchasing this. I bought it for my daughter for her birthday and it came broken. I missed the return window. Very unhappy with this purchase.
Its smaller than I thought it would be. But, for the two of us it a great size.....work very well! Just cut the oven time in half.

Gave as a "Hostess Gift" to my daughter. She was super impressed with the color--more mint than turquoise and wanting to eat more healthy, it was a very welcomed gift. Sturdy and the basket is larger than expected.
Love love love! I am so excited to use this dryer more! Tonight I made fried pickle slices and they were amazing. The fryer is easy to use and clean and I love the fun turquoise color.
It is small but perfect for 2 people!!! We bought this for our RV. It is just the right size!! Easy to use!! Easy to clean!!
I am IN LOVE! This is so easy to easy to use. Tried it with tater tots, popcorn chicken and fresh cauliflower. Photos attached. Buy one!

This thing works great! Doesn't take up much counter space either. Very easy to use and to clean. Fun to experiment with. Probably best for only one person. Might work for two people, but don't count on it.
This is like a more expensive oven wave. I've tried a couple items in it so far, and they haven't come out tasting remotely akin to deep fried at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is an awesome fryer but it is very small
reviews.reviewText: This is an awesome fryer but it is very small, smaller than i realized. Love the color , and it does not take up much space at all. I feel this would work for RV's or very small spaces. It was a gift and it didnt work for them so I am sending it back.

I purchased the larger air fryer and was pleased with how it cooks but it is so big I can’t leave it on my counter. Well this little gem is absolutely perfect! It does everything the larger fryer does only on a smaller scale. It also looks great!

reviews.reviewTitle: way too small, even for 1 person
reviews.reviewText: As soon as I opened this, I just put it back in the box to send back. I knew it was a smaller fryer but the basket is just super tiny.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes great fries but product not well thought out.
reviews.reviewText: The little screw that holds the basket to the handle keeps coming out. Makes shaking half way through nearly impossible. I'm very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: My mother in got this for us as a gift
reviews.reviewText:
So, this cooks well. I like that the tray to put food in is metal, not high temp plastic or something...

Cooking Time:
This cooks things a lot faster than in my oven and doesn't take 20 minutes to preheat. The oven is around 4500 watts and this is around 1000, so this should take a lot less energy.

The Smell:
You get a moderately strong smell from this when it is cooking when it is new. At first I thought it was plastic, but now I think it is the coating they put on the cooking pan.

Controls:
It is missing and off and on button, and the ability to change the timer to zero after your cooking is done. Sometimes things cook a little faster.

Complaint:
The controls and the initial smell would be my only two complaints at this time. So if your food is done before the timer you set, you need to leave the food tray partially out to keep the device from turning back on. A power switch would be nice. Also the ability to turn the timer counter clockwise would be nice, and would suffice to turn the device off.

The taste of the food:
The food tastes the same as when I back it in the oven. I have these chicken nuggets I get for when we are out of food, and I normally microwave them, which doesn't make them have any flavor. Backing them in this device does't take long, and they taste much more flavorful than from the microwave.

I like it. It was a good gift!
This worked fine but it is tiny. Only was able to fit one burger patty in there at a time. We returned it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not BUY , totally unreliable and no support
reviews.reviewText: Junk. JUNK. Worked three times, then no longer heated. Called help line, joke , no one answered. Question why Amazon sells such products

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke sometime between first and second use
reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: It broke after the first time I used it, I tried using it for a second time and I couldn’t get it to work. I was very excited about the chicken nuggets I made the first time though.
Compact and great. Use daily for a quick dinner. Easy to clean. Light weight and doesn’t take up too much space.

The product worked very well for a year. It was easy to use and cleaning was super easy. However, just recently its inside circulating fan stopped working rendering it useless. I hope they make it last much longer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just as it indicated. Easy to use and clean
reviews.reviewText: I was so surprised how good my sweet potato fries turned out. I have used it to roast veggies. For my husband and I ... perfect size and more
Fantástico, muy bueno para una pareja, para más de 2 personas es pequeña. Lo recomiendo ampliamente.
Especially good for frozen fries, onion rings, chicken tenders
I purchased the air fryer because I have been wanting to try air frying. It does what it says and I like some things air fried.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect size. Highly recommended for frozen food
reviews.reviewText:
COOKING REVIEW:
Today, this Dash unit became my introduction to air frying and I'm super impressed with the results. So far, I've only done some frozen popcorn shrimp and fries, and for those two foods at least, I know I'll never go back to using an oven or deep fryer. In my oven, these things usually came out as some weird hybrid of soggy and burnt. With my deep fryer, I got better texture than the oven, but the extra calories usually aren't worth it to me. This Dash air fryer, on the other hand, gives me everything I'm looking for. If I hadn't made them myself, you definitely could've fooled me into believing the food came out of a deep fryer. Of course the real test for this air fryer will be when I decide to make "fried" food from scratch; but for frozen junk, I couldn't recommend it more highly.

Update: I made some potatoes and "fried" chicken thighs from scratch (pictured), and I'm still impressed.

SIZE REVIEW:
I'm running low on counter space, so I wanted a unit with a small footprint or that was at least light/compact enough to tuck away in a cabinet. This Dash fryer gives me both. It's about 13 inches tall, which seems pretty standard for an air fryer. But its footprint is only a little larger than a gallon of milk. It's also very light, which is appreciated when taking it out of the cabinet.

The Dash's basket is 6.5 inches wide. Without stacking, I was able to fit 2 chicken thighs at a time. For larger pieces of meat, you'll probably be limited to cooking them one at a time, which might get annoying. But for stackable foods like chicken nuggets, fries, veggies, etc, the Dash should easily be able to fit a two-person batch. As a single person, this size works for me.

I bought my air fryer in late August. I've used it several times since purchasing it, and love it. I've cooked brussel sprouts, potato wedges, fries, chicken thighs and drumsticks, and chicken wings so far. I live in the Gulf Coast, which of course means it's hot as hell and turning on the oven, even with a.c. running is a not my favorite. I like the convenience of being able to cook in this fryer a variety of foods without having to turn on my oven, making my house hotter. Also, I like how fast it seems to cook foods because of the heat circulating around the food in a smaller space than a traditional oven. I would, and have, recommended this product to friends and family.

If you have a kid who is a chicken nugget and fries nut like mine, this is a game changer! Saves heating the stove for 30+ min to 400 degrees to cook for 10 min. I tried this out as soon as I got home (love my kitchen gadgets). Pretty intuitive use, no preheating required, and no additional grease. You can add seasoning before cooking. I put about 4oz of oreida extra crispy fast food fries in for 10min @400 and that was a bit much so this is def a hot box. If there was more product or a combo of fries and nugs, I think 10 min would be sufficient. Clean up was a breeze, and it cools down pretty quickly. Tho I didn’t actually touch the machine while running, I can feel heat from it by hovering my hand about an inch away from it, so beware to give it space while using.
Very happy with my impulse buy! Will update if it explodes LOL! 😆

I received one as a Christmas gift from my daughter. I wanted it to work for me. I quickly realized I did not like it and had her return it.
1. The temperature control dial could not be set to 400 F. -- the dial would not turn that far.
2. The fryer's power cord is not long.
3. It is easy to clean, as long as one is careful not to lose the rubber "feet" on the basket/strainer -- one came off during washing and nearly got washed down the sink drain.
4. I find it easier to just to make my food in a conventional oven. It is less work. An example -- I can make sweet potato fries from two sweet potatoes in one batch in the oven. In the air fryer, I had to make MANY, MANY batches since they could only be in a single layer in the tiny basket per the included recipe book instructions. Plus they needed to be shaken half way thru frying. So every 5 minutes I had to do something: add fries, shake, remove fries, add fries, shake.... In the conventional oven, they get flipped once. I can focus on other kitchen tasks using the conventional oven.
5. The fryer basket was too small to make soda bread unless I made mini-loafs, but then I'd have to buy a small baking dish that would fit inside the fryer.
6. I don't eat animal products, so frying chicken and such is not a factor.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've lost weight, the kids are finally eating!
reviews.reviewText: I think the best way to lose weight isn't a diet,, but is making lifestyle changes that you can stick too. This air fryer is a game changer for me. This air fryer I makes the SAME FOOD that I already eat healthier, (and in my opinion, taste better). I have been losing about a half pound a week, without changing anything other than how I am cooking my food. I highly recommend this for any person who has kids who are picky eaters, or people who want to lose some weight, and keep it off!

reviews.reviewText: Too small but I could have lived with that. The main problem is the top of your food gets too cooked and will burn if you don’t stop and turn everything over.

I’ve been hearing great things about air fryers and wanted to buy one. I shopped in discount stores but couldn’t settle on the best brand because reviews were mixed. The light bulb went off to visit the Good Housekeeping site to see which one got their seal of approval. Dash wins and has a 4 year warranty. I used it the first day and haven’t turned on the stovetop or oven yet. Summer is nearly here and this new gadget will get a lot of action. I warmed up chicken and the air fryer made it like new. The skin was crispy like I just got it out of cooking oil. No buyer’s remorse here.

reviews.reviewTitle: OMG I am in love with my new Dash Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: I purchased an air fryer about 8 months ago and had to return it. It was huge and took up a good chunk of space on my (already small) countertop. I kept looking for a compact air fryer that would not eat up space and now I found it. I was already in love with my Dash egg cooker and now I can ad my Dash Compact Air Fryer. It is a perfect size for the 3 of us and sits proudly on my countertop. It arrive on time yesterday, and I used it right away to air fry pizza wontons. They were done in 5 minutes and were delish and crispy. Cleanup was a snap! I can't wait to get done work so I can go home and air fry me some chicken patties. Thank you DASH

reviews.reviewTitle: Not happy. Choose a different brand
reviews.reviewText: I havent used my air fryer but a few times. I was opening it to check my food and the handle broke off. My husband was able to get it open after some finagleing. Not happy. Choose a different brand! Customer service was awesome. They are replacing my unit. I have to settle for a different color. I have red. Bummer.

I LOVE this product!
It’s the perfect size for my counter space challenged kitchen and I love that it’s not complicated to use.
Two dials one is a timer and the other is for temperature. No engineering degree required to learn how to use it.
I started with raw wings, all I added was salt and pepper and sugar free barbecue sauce. I didn’t add any oil.
400 degrees for 25 minutes for the flat part of the wing and 400 degrees for 30 minutes for the drumstick part. They are so crisp and delicious I can’t believe it. They taste better than deep fried!

I bought an instant pot during Prime day last year as an impulsive purchase hoping I could use it but I barely did. This year it was the turn for air fryer but it turned out to be exactly the thing I was looking for. I'm impatient when it comes to cooking and want to spend as minimal time as I can supervising it. I usually get my frozen stir fry veggie mix or fresh veggies or even tofu and add seasoning. Standing in front of the skillet stir frying these takes time. Switch to air frying them and it's so easy. No hassle and it's easy to clean up.
Requires some experimentation for the correct time and temperature setting and I usually put it for half the interval and stir/flip them and set a timer for the next half.

Note : this is appropriate when cooking for one. If you have more member in the family, get a larger one.

So far, so good. I saw comments complaining about a smell, but it just smells new, and then if you clean it, like it says to do, it is just fine. It cooks great. Made homemade potato wedges for the first use. Cooked them perfectly in about 20 minutes. Super easy to clean and to use. Good for 1-3 people, since it isn't huge. No complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: Handle came off after first use, cheap plastic.
reviews.reviewText: This little guy cooked my fries just fine but the handle came off after just the first use. It is cheap plastic and there is just one screw that holds the handle in place and it couldn't be fixed because it was stripped. Very disappointed since this was my first time using an air fryer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Blown away (not by the hot air) but the high quality of the fryer
reviews.reviewText: Picked up at Target on a whim after hearing rave reviews about air fryers. The price belies the quality and I’m constantly impressed on how simpl and well it performs. I only cook french fries in it, homemade snd bagged, and it handles it flawlessly everytime. The finish on the outside is well coated and should last a long time.

Bought it and returned it. The basket is TINY and cooks 2 jalapeño poppers or 8 pizza rolls at a time. Made a single serving quiche one night and it took 4 times as long as directed, same for a lava cake. I don’t think it gets hot enough to cook food quickly. Garbage air fryer, quite large for the small size of the basket. Glorified (yet somehow worse than) toaster oven.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't waste your money, will not work after only a couple months use.
reviews.reviewText: My dad purchased me this exact air fryer last Christmas. I had been wanting it for months. The first few months it worked great. It fried perfectly without any oil. Then, about one month ago, I took it out to use it and it would not turn on. Conveniently outside of my 6 month warranty. I am extremely disappointed as I was really looking forward to having and using this and it's completely useless now.

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVED IT BUT TIMER STOPPED WORKING
reviews.reviewText: I love this air fryer!! However the timer stopped working after a month or two. It still cooks but if I don’t watch the time, the food will burn. It’s past the time to return it so I’m disappointed. I paid more than the current price too.

Great as a travel size. I travel a lot for work and was looking for something to use in a kitchenette style hotel room. It’s the perfect size. I took a pic next to my nutrabullet that I also travel with to give a size comparison. Very easy to use and clean. I e used it several times on this trip already.

The first time I used this I was making sweet and sour chicken; I wanted the crisp without the breading and this didn’t disappoint. The outside was crispy (but not that dry crispy chicken tends to get) and juicy in the middle. And it had flavor without even being seasoned yet? Amazing!

I had a friend order this for me who is a prime member. It cooks really fast and cleanup is a breeze .I only use it to make french fries. If you are cooking for more than one of two people, you may want to consider getting something bigger.

Great Compact Air Fryer. It definitely is "compact," so don't expect to be able to make a meal that can feed a family of 4 in this fryer. Nevertheless, it is very convenient, and so easy to clean. It is dishwasher safe, but easy enough to wash by hand as well. I have been able to cook french fries, tater tots, mini tacos, and spring rolls thus far. I feel healthier already knowing my favorite fried food aren't drenched in oil.
I was looking at air fryers for awhile. Heard good things about them. This one is small, 1 or 2 servings, but we are only 2 so it works well for us. Beats oil frying or oven made any day!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor design of the most heavily used feature...epic fail
reviews.reviewText: So what gets the MOST use on this product? The HANDLE. Instead of spending a few more cents inserting a metal threaded insert for the screw to threat into, a pointed screw threads directly into the PLASTIC to hold the handle on....how do you think THAT is holding up? Came off on FIRST use...tightened it some, came off on second, third, 4th use...other than the poor design and handle falling off each use, the air fryer works great
I really love this item! I use it mainly for frozen fries but will be trying more ideas I saw online! This one was 50$ less than the other brand I was looking at..
My first time owning the dash air frying ,was really surprised @how crispy my chicken came, i would reccommend this air fryer it arrived quickly well package

This air fryer is very cute. Its perfect for a single or couple. You have to experiment awhile to figure out the perfect time and temperature. I wish the recipe book was more comprehensive. It works alright but its very noisy....

I love this air fryer! We had a different brand before but it was bulky and took up so much space. This however is small enough to be unseen and plus it's so cute. I bought two more as gifts for others.

reviews.reviewerName: The Mystic Eye Of The Hipster
reviews.reviewText:
The basket tray is an impossible nuisance.
Scrubbing with rags, with brushes, with paper towels, washing multiple times in the dishwasher--it just won't come clean!

Dash 1.6 is perfect for my needs. Have not had a colossal failure yet! Bigger air fryer that I gave away to a friend with a family. My little Dash is all I need. I would love to have accessories that would fit inside of it. Any suggestions?
This is really small but it does work. It’s perfect if you don’t have a lot of storage but still want an air fryer. So much faster than an oven

reviews.reviewTitle: Just got this and love it so much
reviews.reviewText: Just got this and love it so much ! No computer controls, less is more. Quality looks great and time will tell on longevity of the product.

reviews.reviewTitle: I’ll buy again for another family member.
reviews.reviewText: Got this for my mom for mother’s day we cannot stop using it. Food is good cooked In it.
Give it time to heat up, around 5 minutes, and it works like a mini oven.
I got this for $40 and it was heaven sent. I live alone and this is the perfect size for a single person
Works very well and easy to clean. Easy to use and cooks the food well & relatively quickly. Would recommend if you like fried foods (fries, tots, wings, etc) because it makes it feel healthier.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Broke after 3 months of use, won’t come on. When it worked we loved it, but won’t buy again.
Returned because this thing was way too small. Fine if you're a single person, but will not work for a family.
Gift for my aunt, she loves it.
I am in love w my air fryer. I love making frozen fries and quick roasted veggies in it! #VeganLife
seems pretty cool so far, made a few things and the whole basket is dishwasher safe

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not waste your money on this fryer.
reviews.reviewText:
First of all the cooking times are way off.My tater tots were burned to a crisp. I am thinking the rest of the cooking times
will also be off.
Perfect size for 2 people

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish it came in bigger size.
reviews.reviewText: At first i purchased just try an air fryer. And it was an expensive what you meant that if I didn't like it I wouldn't be losing out on a whole lot of money. But then I liked it. This brand works really well. And it's fairly quiet. The only problem is it's too small. Because now I want a bigger one and have to try another brand.
Fine product

reviews.reviewTitle: Very little difference in taste from frying
reviews.reviewText: Same great taste as frying without the added calories from oil. Can't tell the difference.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tray is held on with plastic screw
reviews.reviewText: I was cooking up some chicken wings in the air fryer (only my second time using it) when I went to pull out the tray the bowl immediately separated from the handle. I ended up burning my hand slightly when instinct kept me from dumping the wings all over the floor. After looking at the handle, I saw the remains of a plastic screw or plastic rivet. This is not good as it is directly in the flow of the hot air and in contact with the metal bowl. I do not recommend buying this. Go find a safer air fryer!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, until all the nonstick comes off!
reviews.reviewText: I've had this AirFryer for about a year - and it was perfect for six months. It's pretty easy to clean, cooks evenly, and is small enough to be on the counter in my uber-tiny one-person NYC apartment kitchen. However, about 6 months into use, the nonstick coating started coming off. Now, as I said, small kitchen, so I don't have a dishwasher. I hand-washed the unit with Dawn and a sponge after each use. And, boy, did the nonstick really start coming off! At this point, the basket is about half-rust, half-non-stick. I suppose I could buy a new basket, but my thinking is...I should probably just buy a better-constructed unit.

I have cooked frozen foods (chicken nuggets, French fries, tator tots, corn dogs, fish sticks, cheese sticks) and fresh broccoli. Everything has come out crispy. I love my air fryer!
